I attended a meeting at urlLink GHT last night because our season starts this Saturday, and came back with an abundance of mosquito bites and scratches on my arm. I guess someone decided to play a little Wiffle ball before our meeting started, and the ball went into the shrubbery about 100 times, and each time I reached in, I came out with battlescars on my arms. So I'm quite itchy this morning, but trying not to scratch. I want to go back to school to work on my master's, but I don't know what to master. I'm actually contemplating nixing the whole teaching area and going into public relations/speech/linguistics. Not all 3, but one of those. My major was in interpersonal communication. I have lots of forms to fill out, and still have to take my GRE. I'm going to post the very last part of my story, but I also think it's still weak. I like the ending, but as far as how to write it better and explain things more clearly, I'm still working on it. So hope you liked it if you read it. Coreys court date was a month later. I didnt go to the hearing. Corey was found guilty. There were traces of blood found at the murder scenes that matched his. Now hes in jail, probably waiting for the death penalty down the road, and Im living happily with Sammy. Isnt love blind? Now Im living with Sammy and my ex-boyfriend is in jail for my crimes. Corey didnt really kill anyone. I did. Erika, Ashley, and Josie hurt my Sammy, and Andy stayed with that bitch Josie. I had been with Sammy since Josie broke it off with him. I knew him well now, and knew he was hurt. They deserved what they got. Like I said, Corey was careless. He drove recklessly, and was always late for school. He was always injuring himself-cutting himself. How could you not find his blood? I found plenty of it, and found good uses for it as well. Now tell me, is love blind or is justice blind?

It's 9:03am. Wow, that feels early. This is the result of working in a movie theater until 2am regularly. If you are looking for action and excitement in the life of Rob, well..... too bad. Anyway, I am going to school again today to discuss my master's project with a professor. He sent me an email with a few papers last week seeing if I was interested. The stuff seemed right up my alley, so I told him so and promptly arranged an appointment to hammer out details. When I show up at this time, He talks to me for literally 45 seconds, handing me 3 pieces of paper, one of which is almost a doodle. We do not discuss what his actual interest is in this material sample he wants me to study, a timetable for doing anything, when I can use the lab, who might help me learn some of the lab equipment, etc. Nice meeting. Anyway, I go back today, so that could help. As for the New England Sucktriots... they were the suckiest bunch of sucks who ever sucked. I actually wrote an article about them on Sunday for some free sports newspaper in Boston. The paper has been out for 2 weeks, and its one of the free things people read on the train. I felt better when they wrote back to me on Sunday saying they got lots of articles and the only one to be printed was mine. However, I don't get paid since the paper is in infancy stages. Coincidentally, thats why I can write for them. Also the paper comes out tommorrow, so I have no idea if it will really be there and if its all edited up. This is the closest thing to news in my life. Other activites of the past week include: making smoothies, buying a shot of wild turkey for a 21-year old photographer friend on his birthday, watching some street performer fit through a squash raquet with some confusing girl, leaving the last train of the night with the photographer so he could throw up some wild turkey among other things, listening to an entire Bruce Springsteen concert on my friend's roof and outside Fenway Park (very good indeed), sending most of the day employees home at the movie theater since we have no money since there are no customers, and of course making sure the photographer got home alive via buying a cab as to leave the remaining wild turkey on the sidewalk. Blog out yo.

The bloggers' football teams are a combined 1-3 after the opening weekend. Is this a sign of things to come? Yeah, probably. Den, did you happen to see the Cuse/UNC game on Saturday? It wasn't televised up here, but it seemed like a pretty awesome game from the score and stats. I know the outcome wasn't what you would have liked, but exciting nonetheless. As for fans in Bengaldom, their sheer stupidity goes along with the ineptness of the team the past decade. I've been hearing some fans wanted coach Lewis to put in Palmer because Kitna was awful, but Palmer wasn't even active. He's not going to play until their season is officially over, like after 8 games or so maybe, when they'll be 2-6 or 1-7. The team itself is the same old story. They get down by 20 points in the first half, and the game is over, because their offense doesn't know how to win a game. Pathetic. I got a Hey Mercedes poster in the mail today for their new album, but I don't know why. I'm not complaining though... Where's Kevin when you need him? I'm actually listening to an old Everclear cd right now. Well, here's the next part of my story: I quietly scaled the stairs and slipped into my room. I grasped a business card and dialed Andys uncle. I whispered to him that I suspected the killer to be in my house. Corey must have heard the phone click down because he came running into my room to see whom I was talking to. I said nobody. I lied. He knew I lied. He looked at me funny. I asked him how the chicken was coming along. He said good, but he cut his finger again. He always cut his finger. He was careless. He just stood there, holding the knife tightly, looking at me in puzzlement. Boom! The front door collapsed. The police barreled into my room and whisked Corey away in cuffs. They had saved me for now. Andys uncle comforted me and told me everything would be OK now. I know. Two of my best friends were murdered, and I stopped him from killing again.

Today I went job hunting yet again, but realized once again that the mall is a horrible place. Not much accomplished again. I ate tuna for lunch. I've really grown to like tuna over the years, but still can't get over the fact that it comes in a can. I'm finally able to just pretend that it's not cat food. I remember the first time I tried the tuna that's vacuum sealed in the pouches, but that made it seem even worse-tuna in a bag? Anyway, it's eaten. While on my journeys, I picked up a frame from Linens and Things for my autographed Face to Face poster. Well, when I tried putting the poster in, I noticed the interior part of the glass was gritty and dirty somehow, so I took it out to clean it off with some glass cleaner. Upon cleaning the surface, I found that the cleaner only removed the grime, but there was still streaks and blotches on the glass I could not remove. So I tried to put the glass back into the frame, but somehow it did not fit. I was able to remove it, but it seemed impossible to get back. So I tried pushing the little metal clasps(the ones that keep the cardboard and picture in the frame) as flush against the wood as possible, since I realized the glass was hitting them. After completing this task and brutalizing my thumb with the pushing, the glass fits, only to shatter seconds later. I don't know how it broke, but it did. So now there's a corner of the frame that just cracked right away from the rest of the glass. I cut three of my fingers during this fiasco, and decided that i was not going throw out the frame. I took some household cement(the same stuff that failed to hold my rearview mirror) and applied it to the shards of glass. I set them in place, so hopefully it will hold. The glass will still have two cracks that will be obvious, but right now, if it holds, I'll be happy. I have to wait till tomorrow to put the poster in, though. Well, it's the weekend, and it's actually really nice outside. Woo! Pizza tonite. Here's the next part of the story: I started seeing things in my mind. Erika and Ashley. Andy and Josie. Then I saw Corey. What did Corey have to do with them? He knew Andy and Josie, but what did that mean, and what about Erika and Ashley? The six oclock hour rolled around and I was actually getting hungry. My grumbling stomach told Corey. He said hed help me put something together for dinner. We had to eat something, otherwise wed feel worse. I looked in the freezer to find ice cream, waffles, and a package of chicken cutlets. We decided to have some chicken. I went to the basement to find something to eat with the chickencreamed corn or some slop like that in a can. I never wanted Corey down there because it was a disaster. My parents left it in shambles when they moved into a new house. I was embarrassed by the mess. He started preparing the chicken. After selecting my canned vegetable of choice, I made my way back up the stairs. I caught a glimpse of Corey in the kitchen holding a knife. The thinking resumed. I saw things in my mind going in reverse order, like when rewinding a video tape while watching it. The tape froze. Play. Before Corey and I got together, Corey tried to win over Erika and Ashley. He was desperate before I met him. He wanted a girlfriend so badly, and I gave him a chance. Was the killer in my house? Was he making chicken in my house with a very sharp knife?

Today was my first day back at school. I wasn't very excited about this because I took 2 summer classes and I felt like I never the left the place. Especially since I finished my last summer class exactly a week ago. Oh what I won't do to graduate in 4 years. Today was Accounting and Religions of the World. Me? In a religion class? FUNNY!!! I think they're going to be fairly easy classes. Tonight I have Business Math: Calculus. All you math nerds can appreciate how excited I truly am to be taking a calculus class. Next semester- Statistics!!! When I got home from class, I took a glance at all the classes I still need to take and I was saddened at what I saw. I still have a butt load of general requirements to take, among these being 3 contemporary issues classes. Why do I have to endure this pain? To be a well rounded person? Who wants to be round? Not me!! Anyways, tomorrow I'm up again at 5:30am to my Business Law and Italian classes. I hope they're both somewhat easy especially Italian. I took Spanish for 5 years and I still can't carry a conversation so maybe if I pay attention this time it will make it easier... Ciao!

I almost forgot a very important thing to talk about today. I know the other bloggers here either don't care for hockey, or are devils fans, but I am a Rangers fan, and not the best hockey fan, but I was a huge fan of urlLink this man . And if you believe otherwise, look at the poster on my wall of the man from his first NHL season, where he didn't have the modern mask with all the painted designs on it. It will be a sad time for me at 3:00 pm today, when Mike Richter announces his retirement. I may shed a tear because I'm a big puss, but the man was the New York Rangers for the past decade. Sure, you can argue with Messier, but Richter was huge in their 94 playoff run, and may not have been one of the best goalies in the league over the years, but he was one of the best in Rangers history, in terms of victories. On top of all this, he was born in the U.S., so that makes it even better that he had a good career and wasn't born in Slovakia or some other European country. Now that I've babbled for quite some time, I will wrap this up. Here's to you, Mr. Richter.

It's officially September. You know why? When I drive down Broad Street, there's dozens of hoodlums standing outside the deli by the high school. I never quite understood the phenomena. Let's stand clustered really close together and smoke cigarettes in the rain ouside of a deli. Yeah, that's hardcore. A deli that's right next door to a florist. I don't know. Tonight kicks off the urlLink NFL season. I don't care about the Redskins/Jets, however. Here's my predictions for the NFL season: Bengals finish 6-10 with wins over denver, baltimore, arizona, houston, pitt, and st. louis. i'm hoping for better, but don't expect it. i have every right not to. it's been 12 years without playoffs. NFC North: Packers, Vikings, Lions, Bears NFC East: Eagles, Giants, Cowboys, Redskins NFC South: Bucs, Falcons, Panthers, Saints NFC West: Rams, Seahawks(my surprise team), 49ers, Cards Wild Card=Falcons, Giants NFC Champ Game:Eagles over Falcons AFC North: Browns, Steelers, Ravens, Bengals AFC East: Patriots, Bills, Dolphins, Jets AFC South: Titans, Colts, Jags, Texans AFC West: Chiefs, Raiders, Broncos, Chargers Wild Card: Bills, Raiders AFC Champ Game: Titans over Patriots Super Bowl: Titans over Eagles *disclaimer: Do not use these as your own picks, or you will burn in hell and be ridiculed enormously. The author has no clue about picking football standings. This is all in good fun. OK, now that's over. Here's the next part of my story: I woke up at about ten on Saturday morning. I probably would have slept through Saturday completely, but the doorbell woke me up. It was the police. Hello, Miss, Im Officer Taylor, Andys uncle. I was informed that you were a friend of Josie and Andy. Yes, wh--whats happened? Well, Miss, he paused and I noticed his adams apple bob in his throat, as if he was swallowing back something. They were found dead this morning. His eyes watered. Im very sorry. If theres anything I can doHeres my card. Please take care, and we promise we will end this case soon. I will make sure of that. Im so sorry. I cried and closed the door lightly. I slid to the floor with my back to the door. I picked up the phone to call Corey. I couldnt compose myself enough to be comprehendible, however. I finally was able to spit out in blurts, Coreyneedyouhere. He was at the door when the I hung up the phone. He came over and tried to comfort me. I weeped in his arms for what seemed to be hours. He seemed very uneasy about the situation as well. He shook at times, and choked back tears often, as he and Andy were becoming closer as friends. Ive got a bad feeling about this, he said. Me too, hon. I mean, Im getting a bad vibe right now. What do you mean? I think I should go see if I can help Andys uncle. I want this creep put away now. No, you cant, please. I need you here. Dont leave me. All right, but I just wish this never happened. I wish I could go back in time or something to stop it. I dont know what to do. I feel helpless. He was right. We quivered nervously for the rest of the afternoon. Every noise we heard caused a rush to see if the door was still locked, and with each click, chirp, or thud, I began to think more.

Hmm. I went job-hunting today. The fruits of my labor were not rewarded, however. The closest I got was an application for Modell's, and Kim hooked me up with the person in charge of personnel at her bank. The lady seemed nice, and told me to send in my resume, but she'll be away next week and probably won't get back to me until the following week. I went to Target, because they are opening a new store in nearby Clifton soon. I asked the lady at Guest Services, and she had no idea what I was talking about. She said you can apply on the computers. So I attempt to do the computer thing. First off, the computers were slow, and after I was halfway through, this error message came up, and I couldn't get out of it, so I just started pounding the keyboard. It finally took me back, and I was able to continue. When I was on the last part, it said these questions were optional, so I decided just to hit enter and move on. Suddenly, the screen pops up saying "Thank You" with that stupid Target dog. So I left. I was there for an hour with that stupid computer. I say I was done. Here's an update on things I said I would bring up again: 1)my rearview mirror is indeed staying put on my windshield. I guess that kit worked for now. 2)my foot is still painful when I walk on it. Don't know what to do about it. Here's the next piece of my story. It's very short: Andy and Josie were snuggling on her couch watching television. Even after the tragedies, they still managed to find comfort in each other. Friday night was a horrible night to be home. There was never anything on, except sometimes there were some good stand-up comics on cable. The couple managed to forget about the world and laughed at the comedy routines they witnessed. There was a pleasant variety of performers that gave the audience a chuckle. A short, plump male managed to coax the most laughter from the two. As the emcee was introducing the next comic, and a loud noise rumbled in Josies kitchen. The laughter had stopped.

If anyone knows of a place I can work full time, let me know please. God, I hate this. I spent several more hours on the Internet researching jobs I would be qualified for with a BA in Interpersonal Communication, and there's some things that don't sound too bad, but I can't suddenly become a copy writer or advertising specialist without experience. This is too depressing, and the 60 degrees and rain aren't helping either. I was actually contemplating going to one of those computer training schools for computer graphics and design stuff, but I would need money to pay for it, and a job to supply the money to pay for it, and if I had a job, I probably wouldn't want to do that anyway. In other news, Roy Halladay owned the Yankees yesterday, and it was enjoyable watching the Jays win a game, since I hadn't seen them win on tv since the end of May probably. In a way, I kind of feel bad for Jeff Weaver. I don't like the Yankees, but if he was on another team that was mediocre, he wouldn't be scrutinized nearly as much. Yeah, he isn't very good, but when Josh Phelps blasted that 3-run homer in the 8th yesterday, Weaver's head just fell, and I actually felt sorry for him. The game was over anyway, because fat Wells allowed 5 runs before Weaver entered. Oh well. Today doesn't feel like Tuesday to me. And it doesn't feel like September. It feels more like the middle of October. Dreary and chilly. Well, here's another part of my story: Corey brought me to his house. I thought he was hiding something from me. He didnt say much since Andy showed him the newspaper in the morning. I told him to take me to my home, since his absence of mind wasnt contributing to any comfort for me. I would have been better off alone. Maybe I could clear my head and forget about things for a while. Corey walked my to my door and made sure I was in before retreating back to his place. He ate some pizza and watched the game all night. He knew not to call when I ask him to be alone for a while. I always called him when I was ready. It was six oclock, so I watched the news when I got home. They reported that Sammy had apparently left town and the police couldnt trace his whereabouts. He was gone. They fucked up. Commercial. I was too worked up to eat dinner that night, so I continued to watch the science channel until about ten. I decided my eyes were tired at that point, so I went to sleep.

Happy Bday, Ord! My dad's the best. I had a new revelation for a job...I want to work in a hotel, and work my way up, so one day, I can travel to fun places and stay for free in part of the hotel chain I work for. That would be sweeeet. But in reality, I don't see it happening. I'm going to try my damnedist to make it happen though, since this teaching thing isn't calling me. I need a job with money and benefits right now, and subbing's not gonna do it for me. Well, I have the next part of my story: On the ride home, I was dozing, but I do remember one thing-the radio. Corey always played around with the radio in the car, and rarely settled on a station for more than a song. This night was strange because he didnt fuss around. He hit the preset channel 6 and news blared from his speakers all around my skull. Through all the commotion and vibrations of bass in his woofers, I do remember being awake when a reporter stated that Sammy was released because they didnt have any evidence to contain him. Coreys car stopped. I was home. I hugged Corey and sleep-walked to my bed. I made sure to lock the door and secure the deadbolt. I slipped off my shirt and jeans and dove into a big t-shirt. I fell to my bed like and was nestled among my pillow friends. The next afternoon, we all met at the usual spot in the student center. Andy came running in with that mornings paper. Someone else was murdered last night. It was Ashley Myers. She was found with a note. The same one that was with Erika. Josie cried out nervously, almost like a yelp. I put my hand over my mouth, trying to hold back my almost-vomit. This time, Andy wasnt joking about the murder. He was shaken. He was almost in tears. Corey stood there, blankly staring at the paper. That Sammys one sick fucker, screamed Andy. It said they just released him, and he kills someone else. Josies mouth opened ever so slowly. It took a few tries of her quaking lips, but she finally spoke. Ashley Myers was one of Sammys ex-girlfriends. Im the last one he had. Im next. She took a jump step to run away, but Andy grabbed her. No youre not, he said. Im here and youll be safe. I promise. We adjourned our daily meeting earlier than normal on Friday. I dont think anyone went to class that day. We all left. Andy and Josie went to her place. Andy, whats happening? Josie asked. Some guy named Sammy murdered two girls. Thats it. And Im next. What am I supposed to do? I cant hide forever. He knows where I live. He knows too much about me. Hon, Im going to stay with you tonight, and until they catch him. I promise you will be OK. My uncle tells me the second case will only prove it was Sammy, so when they get a hold of him this time, he wont be able to get away through some loophole. If theres one person I can trust on the police force, its definitely my uncle. You know Uncle Trever is not going to bullshit me. I know he wouldnt b.s. you, but they still havent been able to find Sammy yet. Hes as good as caught Jo.

I would love to share the story of our ice fiasco... We were sent to get ice by Brian's sister-in-law Rachel after we finished helping her with the food. So we treked down to the 7-11 and bought 6 bags of ice. We had 2 coolers so we figured it would be enough. WRONG!! As we were filling up the coolers Bri said, "Hey I think we need more ice." I said, "OK. Go get some more." So I gave him the keys to my beautiful Altima and he came back with 4 more bags(i think it was 4). So we finished loading the sodas and ice into the coolers when Brian says, "Oh shizzy. What about the beer?" I said "what beer? there is no beer here." Brian replied that people were bringing beers. At this moment Rachel pops out of the door and we ask her about the beer. She said oh yeah. So we were shipped off again to Rite Aid to see if they had any coolers and some more ice. But do they have it? Nooooo. Why would they? So we walked over to the liquor store in the same lot and they have ice and those crappy little coolers that couldn't even hold a 6 pack. So then we walk over to the Super Stop and Shop. They call it super for no apparent reason because they were sold out of coolers. If you were so super you would have more coolers in the back room! So at this point me and Brian were we even considering a garbage can to hold the beverages. So we walk over to the dollar store in hopes of finding some sort of container but to no avail. So we go back to the house empty handed. We tell Rachel and Kevin that we couldn't find anything. So she says, "Well can't you go to the hardware store?" Two replies to this: 1. Why can't you go? 2. I've wasted enough gas(which is quite expensive nowadays) and time on your stupid party. Of course I'm not mean enough to say this to her face so we get suckered into going to the hardware store. We get to the store and we don't see any freakin coolers. I remembered there were some containers outside so we check them out. They were 44 gallon rubber things so we called Rachel and she said get it. But we didn't know if we're supossed to take it inside or if they get it from the stock room or some crap. So Bri goes inside to ask and comes back outside to get me. I guess we were blinded by our rage but the coolers were sitting on top of one of the aisles. So we get the kid to take it down and we pay for this crate of evil by the drunken fat guy. We go back to the house and everyone is happy that we found a cooler and brought 6 more bags of ice. But don't you know, their friend Danny brings a huge cooler later on filled with ice. So we went nuts for nothing. So lets tally up some things here: Total trips for ice/cooler- 4 Total amount spent on ice/cooler- about $60 Total amount of gas wasted- too much and i never got refunded for this. Sorry but a hot dog doesn't cut it. Total amout of drinks guzzled down to get rid of anger/headache- not enough
Happy Halloween. Spending the weekend in Vermont, should be fun... cya

Does anyone have a remedy for a super sore neck? My neck frickin hurts! Halloween is tomorrow and the little kids will stay from my house because there is a cemetary right across the street. Maybe they're afraid the zombies will eat their brains. I know I'm afraid. Brian and I are going to celebrate El Dia de la Muerte with my good friend Liz at her house. PARTY TIME!

Thursday. My day off. Oops, scratch that. I was asked yesterday to work today, so I have to go in at 1, and I don't know when I can leave. Apparently, lots of things going down with employees or something. I wasn't too happy yesterday when I was asked, basically because it was 5:25 and I was supposed to leave at 5:30. Not the greatest way to end my shift. Anyway, I think the manager thought we'd have a big rush on our Halloween candy tonite. Enough about that. NBA season is here and I'm not really into it yet. Keith VanHorn had 29 points for the Knicks, but they lost. I'm sick of hearing about Lebron James already. The Sixers are 1-0 and are on ESPN tomorrow nite at Sacramento. Other than that, I don't know what else is happening yet. I had a bunch of things I wanted to get done today, but they'll have to wait. One thing was to get my car checked, but I can't because I'll be using it to get to work. I hope it holds out until next Thursday. On a positive note, I do get my first paycheck today, but I'm sure it will be a great disappointment after I take into account my bills. Well, if I don't blog tomorrow, which I probably won't, then have a fun-filled weekend!

Hey Mercedes rocked NYC! The first band seemed okay at first but the singers voice sucked. The second band was a Thursday rip off - a screamer and a singer. This was the crap band Bri spoke of before. The worst part was that they were trying to get the crowd involved. The singer said, "Even if you don't like us, we're all here because we love music so clap your hands." I'm sorry but the shit they were playing was NOT music. Moving on, Damone was ok but the singers voice wasn't 100%. However, she shreds a guitar solo. I thought Damone was the last band to go on before HM but I was told otherwise. Then Whitelight Motorcade came on. They tried very hard to look rock and roll but they were really a bunch of no talent ass clowns. Everything they played has been done before. They were completely unoriginal. What a waste of time. Then HM came on and all was well. I once again sang every single word to every single song. I'm truly pathetic. They played a lot of new stuff (Quality Revenge at Last, It's Been A Blast, Knowing When to Stop, Lashing Out, Go On Drone) and some of the more popular old songs (Eleven to Your Seven, Stay Six, Our Weekend Starts on Wednesday, Go Blue). They played Go Blue as an encore but damn Irving Plaza has a curfew so we couldnt hear anymore of our favorites. I think it's very ridiculous that a club has a curfew. Oh well. I think the show was worth the 12 bucks just for Hey Mercedes alone. Everyone in the band was totally into it and you can tell that they're having fun up there. Although this trip to the city wasn't so bad, I let it be known to a member of hm that they have to play at Maxwells every time they come to NJ. Anyone who has been to Maxwells knows why. Enough about hm! I'm doing just fine in case anyone was wondering. Let me sum everything up for ya: School's a bitch. Work sucks. I'm no longer sick. I need a vacation but definitely not to Myrtle Beach. Hope everyone is doing well. Bye!!! :)

Damn, it's been a while since my last blog. Times have been busy for the new worker, so I've been a slackin'. The new job is pretty good so far. Still don't know what my daily duties will be, but the people are nice and it's a job. This weekend was full of many exciting events. I'll go in reverse order and work backwards from today. The urlLink Bengals are 3-4. They are in second place in their division, and already have one more win than they had all of last season, and without their "star" running back, Corey Dillon. More on him in a moment. Anyway, they defeated the previously 5-1 Seahawks 27-24. Their defense allowed only 7 points in the second half, and the TD came withing the first 6 minutes of the 3rd quarter. Two in a row, and next week they travel to Arizona. As for Corey Dillon, he got into a car accident before the game, and hopefully he's ok, which I think he is, but prior to that, he was being a total ass and complaining about not getting the ball enough. First of all, you have to play to get the ball. He's been injured every game! And second of all, the team has now won 3 games without you. They're playing really well and keeping games close, so shut your mouth and play like you're paid to. If not, then they have a perfectly capable backup in Rudi Johnson, who broke 100 yards today. Last night was the urlLink Hey Mercedes show at Irving Plaza in NY. Just seeing the band was nice. I'll have more on that in a moment as well, because there were many ups and downs involved in the night. Upon arriving home, I was informed that the Marlins defeated the Yankees in the World Series. Wow. I'm not going to rub it in, because everyone who blogs is a Yankee fan, but that put a smile on my face before bed. As for the HM show, here's the deal thru a list of pros and cons: PRO: HM played a show CON: It was in NY PRO: HM was headlining CON: There were 4 opening bands PRO: Going with 2 cool people(Kim & Liz) CON: It was in NY PRO: Not driving into city CON: Finding parking in Hoboken PRO: Found parking in lot next to PATH CON: Parking cost $20 PRO: PATH station close to Irving Plaza CON: Forgot how to get to Irving Plaza from PATH PRO: Found place pretty easily CON: It was still earlier than anticipated PRO: Doors open at 7 pm CON: It was 7:10 and I really had to pee PRO: Doors opened at 7:15 CON: First band started at 7:50 PRO: The bar had the Captain CON: Captain & Coke cost $7 PRO: Talked to Bix, the HM tech CON: He had no new t-shirts for sale PRO: 1st band usually plays short set CON: 1st band sucked PRO: 2nd band usually plays short set CON: 2nd band was Canadian and sucked PRO: Saw people we knew(Kate, Dave) CON: Saw plenty of scenesters PRO: 3rd band was Damone CON: There was another band after them PRO: Talked to people we knew CON: Had to leave due to mild case of food poisoning PRO: Returned feeling better CON: There was still another band to play PRO: 4th band looked rock & roll CON: 4th band sucked PRO: HM went on at 10:45 CON: Irving Plaza has a curfew PRO: Found PATH station easily CON: It was 110 degrees in the station PRO: Hit very little traffic on way home CON: My car sounded like it was going to fall apart PRO: Turn back clocks, gain hour of sleep CON: It was still 1:30 So that's a short list of the show's experience. In other news, I'm working 2-11 tomorrow night. I'm wondering what I'll be doing since the managers usually leave at 5, and I have no idea how to do anything yet. Hmm. I'm going to see Dave's band on Wednesday at Just Jake's in Montclair. He plays the keyboard. Should be interesting.
Ok, I had to post this link: urlLink http://grouphug.us/ This site is hilarious.

Day one of my new job. I worked from 9-5:30 and will be tomorrow, Weds, and Friday. I still don't know what my job description is, or what I will be doing. My supposed job title is SIMS coordinator. It's like I'm going to be in charge of inventory-keeping supplies on hand, knowing when we have too much, etc. I'm supposed to find out more on Weds. Tomorrow is truck day, so I'll be busy with that all day. Today consisted of me moving boxes around in the stockroom in preparation for truck tomorrow and attempting to complete a display for Christmas, although it did not turn out well, since we didn' t have enough shelves to complete the task. The people I've me so far have seemed really nice, which is a plus, but I'm not used to working, so my stomach and rest of body are out of whack. I was hungry at 12, but didn't want to eat since I still had 5 and a half hours left. I'm also tired, because I had to do a lot of stupid errands when I got home, so I only got to sit down at 7:30. Anyway, I'm happy I'm working. The place seems nice, and I'm hoping once I find out what my job will be, I can learn that before worrying about every other possible job in the store. Rob, your story was touching, but for some reason, I knew something was going to happen to ruin it. I'm sorry about that. Keep your head up. I ordered the book the other day, because I don't have anything else to read right now, so I'm supposed to receive it this week sometime. Kev, The Matrix Reloaded was indeed a piece of crap. I liked the first movie, and thought the second one made no sense and had really only one scene I enjoyed, which was the last big action scene. I have no urge to see the new one either, but if I do, it will be with the gift certificate I have, so I technically won't be paying for it. Tomorrow's day 2 of work. I gotta get to sleep early tonite, because I'm feeling a little weary and my nose is running. Hope to sleep it off and fight off any cold or such symptoms.

It's Monday, and I dont want to be at work. I am dead tired. This past weekend was not overly relaxing. I stayed in Friday nite and rented The Matrix Reloaded . What a piece of crap. The effects were realistic, but the story was so fricken complicated that it ruined the entire movie. I have very little desire to see the third movie when it comes out now. Saturday nite was fun though. urlLink Meredith and I went to Toad's Place to see Stephen Lynch. He was amazing. I really needed to laugh like that. He didnt have an opening act, so he went on at 8:30 and was done by 10:15, which was nice for an old guy like me. He played most of his "classics" and a few new ones. Damn I miss O&A.... Meredith liked everything he played, except for part of his encore, where he performed Kill a Kitten . She loves cats, and found the song offensive, but she laughed anyway. He didnt perform FBA , but he did play the two songs that he considers his worst songs: The Abortion Song and Special Olympics . Also, he made it a point to let everyone know that he got married recently, so I guess he wasnt going to any of the local bars after the show and try to pick up annoying Asian chicks (sorry, that was a reference to something only Rob will get). We got up early Sunday morning to drive all the way back Bloomfield because the 9am mass at Sacred Heart was being dedicated to my grandfather who passed away 20 years ago this past weekend. All of his children and grandchildren were there. It was nice to see my family. We then had lunch at Charlie Brown's in Upper Montclair. I think that half of us did not enjoy our meals. I think that place sucks. It used to be nice, but not anymore. Oh well, back to work.

I'm still not feeling so well. I was actually feeling much better for the past few days thanks to some over the counter cold medication. It cleared up my sinuses but it made my heart race. Despite that, I continued to take it so I could make it through my hectic school/work schedule. I decided on Friday night that I wasn't going to take it anymore, but I woke up on Saturday feeling worse than ever. Of course I had to work, so I decided to take the evil cold meds again. When I got to work my friend/co-worker Michele treated to me to a nice cup of coffee. Bad move. I was so shaky through the day. I was seriously worried about driving home. The ride from Wayne to Clifton, although not very long, is very unfun. So, I swore to myself to NEVER take that shizzle again, but I again woke up today with a stuffy nose. Speaking of stuffy noses, why is it that only one nostril gets clogged? Example, at the moment my right nostril is completely stuffed but my left one isn't. What's the point? I can't breathe too well with just one so clog up both so I can be completely miserable! Anyways, I hope I feel better before Saturday when Bri, my friend Liz, and me go to see our boys Hey Mercedes. Speaking of Hey Mercedes, I've been talking online with Ryan whose a good friend of HM. He's gone on several interviews with this video game company in Chicago. I hope he gets the job. Free video games for all!! SWEET!!!!

So the ball.... Let me tell you about last night. It was like a huge funeral here last night. On my train home last night, the conductor was sobbing. I saw a guy lying face down on a park bench, but he just might have been homeless. Boston just became really quiet. I truly feel quite bad for the fans up here even though there are a ton of assholes. Seeing people just resign themselves to believing this curse crap is real is depressing. Anyway, that being said, it was a great game to finish one of the best series I've ever seen. Unfortunately, this is the World Series that nobody wanted to see, but I think it'll be somewhat close. Sunday Sunday Sunday! Pats- Dolphins. Pats break the jinx 28-20. I think I'll predict a Pats win by the score of 28-20 every week. Its fun. I also read the Corrections, right about a year ago and I agree with Dennis. It's good. I have a copy if you wanna wait until Thanksgivingish or I could just mail it to you. It was Eric's book and I was supposed to mail it to him in like January, but I forgot so he bought another copy. Other stuff: My mom and aunt have been up here since Tuesday visiting. They went to Cape Ann (another quaint area with an Ocean view and little shops like they enjoy) on Tuesday and I went with them for one night. It was good just to spend time with them and whatever, but there was a funny incident. We went to dinner at seafood place called McT's. The food was good, but that's not where I'm going. The waitress was kinda cute and my mother and aunt were making offhand comments that she was 'making eyes' at me. I disagreed, but I did think she was cute. But it was strange because after we left I started thinking about the waitress. I was wondering who ends up as a waitress in Gloucester in October when there are hardly any tourists left. I also was playing with the idea in my head of what would happen if I had actually tried to pick up a waitress while she was working. Not a pretty thought, but anyway. The next day I took the train from Gloucester to Boston in the afternoon since I had to work at night. I caught the 3:48 pm train. So, of course you see where this is going. She stepped right past me as I sat down on the train. I wouldnt think it was weird if there were like tons of people getting on the train, but there were only like 6 or 7 people total. Anyway, she said hi and walked to a different part of the train. I picked up my stuff from the seat and walked to where she was and sat across the aisle. We ended up talking for a good 40 minutes of the hour ride. She's actually really cool, She's 24, and works as a waitress and a landscaper. She was going into the city sice she takes a German course at a language institute. She has moved 3 times in the last 6 months but is from Gloucester, and this is her last visit home before moving west, likely permanently. She played rugby. She also worked in the past as a photo developer and baker and is going to finish her double major in nutrition and German. Just a set of really of really odd details worth noting only because we had a similar feeling in common. Oldness. We both decided that 24 is when we started feeling old and pressure to do something productive with life. We parted and that was that since she's moving away in 2 months anyhow and lives in Gloucester which is 40 miles away. Coincidence makes me laugh sometimes. Blog!!!! urlLink http://www.homestarrunner.com/sbemail87.html

Holy Crap. As much as you all know I hate the Yankees, that game was, in the words of Dennis , Incredible. I'm not going to analyze it or complain about anything the Sox did. You'll hear plenty of that on Sportscenter, etc. I'm going to step aside and actually congratulate the Yankees for proving who the better team was. I'm also applauding MLB for an absolutely amazing post-season so far. Hopefully the World Series will go 7 games as well and continue the trend. The one thing I'll say is that I liked Aaron Boone when he was a Red(ask Kim for the validity of this), and was upset when he came to NY because I knew he was a damn good player. Now all the dumb Yankees fans around my area suddenly love the man. Patience, y'all. Oh by the way, Den's prediction was eerily close. It's Friday! They're actually calling for a nice weekend after today for once. Sounds good to me. Yesterday something strange happened. Here's a little background: My parents are planning on getting our front stairs replaced, as well as the small path to our side door. They are going down the shore for a few days for their anniversary(Sun-Tue). They called the mason to tell him to start the job when they got back from the shore, so he could do it all at once, instead of starting this week and waiting a few days, etc. Kim had been over yesterday afternoon for lunch before her night class. The doorbell rang about 3 pm, but I was in the restroom, so I didn't hear it. She looked, but didn't know who it was. When I returned, I went downstairs to see who it was. I hear loud banging and open my front door to find my front steps being demolished and the railing dismantled. The mason decided to start breaking down the stairs without telling us. So I called my mother to see if I missed something, but she didn't know either. She told them to go ahead and continue, so they could finish the stairs today. So today I heard jackhammering at 8 am, and they're working right now. Should be done with the stairs today, and will probably come back late next week to finish the side path. I guess it wasn't a big deal, but I was thinking about what would happen if we were getting our porch rebuilt. Would they just bring in a wrecking ball without telling us? In other news, I've had a person-less house next door to me for about 8 months now. The previous neighbors just bolted one day. Finally, someone bought it late summer, but he's rebuilding the entire inside-walls, floors, electric-just about everything except the shell of the house. On the other side, we have a strange house. One guy's an Elvis impersonator, and the other guy is a fat, drunk, something. I don't know what he does for a living. But the fat guy's an asshole who parks his big red van on the street and insists on hitting every car while parallel parking. Needless to say, we hate him, and found out the house was recently sold, and I'm told they'll be gone by the end of the year. Woo-hoo! Remember that show Home Improvement? That Wilson guy was the neighbor. Where the hell is our Wilson? Have a good weekend folks. Listen to urlLink Knapsack .

Well, it's officially worry time. Game 7 Yanks vs Red Sox. I'll be so nervous that I won't be able to enjoy the game. Tomorrow is my Neurobiology midterm, so I have another thing to worry about. In class, we watched a video where they gave monkeys Parkinson's by lesioning parts of the brain. Obviously I'm pro research and I think PETA is a bunch of whiny rich kids with nothing better to do, I still felt pretty ill when watching the monkeys tremble. Bri-for books, you should read The Corrections by Jonathon Franzen. It's one of the best books I've read in a long time. After my exam, I was going to give my book rant, much like my Rolling Stone review:), so wait for that. For movies, get Indiana Jones on Tues. While at the bookstore, you should check out the new Esquire magazine. There is some good material in it. "Mmmm. 20 questions with Lorne Michaels" Well I gotta get ready for the game My prediction tonite Yankees 5 Red Sox 4.

Congratulations to the Chicago Cubs for sucking. As long as their world series drought continues, I can no longer accept Bengals ridicule. HAHA! No, I was kinda rooting for them, but I'm totally fine with the Marlins, it just doesn't sound right. I also didn't want Kerry Wood to take the loss, but the whole team just collapsed after a 3-1 series lead. I'll wait for the Sox-Yanks tonite... I'm officially starting my job Monday. I'm working Mon, Tue, Wed, and Fri from 9-5 for a total of 32 hours. It's my first week, so Monday I'll probably set up a fixed schedule for the weeks to follow and increase the hours up to 40. I'm technically going to be in a management position, so that's gonna be nice. I have to wear a shirt & tie, but as Kim said, I would have had to if I was teaching too. I'm happy because I'll be getting some money and benefits. Whew! I was starting to get nervous about the lack of insurance. Well, it's Thursday, so I'm gonna meet Kim for lunch/dinner. She's feeling a bit better, so I'm glad. I feel like celebrating my job, but I don't have money from the job to celebrate the job. Huh? I decorated my house for Halloween yesterday. I still enjoy this holiday for some reason, even though I don't dress up or anything. I guess I'm still 10 in my mind. Anyone recommend any good books, movies, or cds? I plan on buying one or more of each with my first paycheck. Especially movies and books. urlLink Let me know . Thanks.

Wow, it's a good thing I didn't jinx the Cubs last nite. What the hell was that all about?! Today's my parents' anniversary, so Happy Anniversary! Not like they're going to read this, but maybe they'll get the message telepathically. I watched Conan last nite, and Jim Carrey was his first guest. It was a rerun, but Carrey did In The Year 2000 with him and was frickin' crazy. Later, during his interview, he did this bit with Stephen Hawking. Very funny stuff, and apparently, I heard that Carrey actually went to visit Hawking for dinner a few weeks after the original show was recorded. I believe it was in June of this year. Next Saturday is HM at Irving Plaza. All right! I hate the city.

My baby is sick. This sucks. I did my best to take care of her today. I'm sure I'll be getting sick soon. Probably the kid with the outbreak cough from Friday night passed it along... Congratulations to Rob for guessing the lyric. It was indeed Skee-Lo from his song I Wish . You win! I got my oil changed in my car today, and the guy tells me that my radiator is corroded a bit inside, and my coolant is dirty. That sucks, because I got a new radiator put in by my awful mechanic last November, and it had a year warranty. How does it wear down so quickly? Anyway, I now have to get it flushed out and get my tires rotated for the winter, so my car doesn't ice-skate, and my engine doesn't get frostbite. The Sox are pretty much cooked. I don't see the Yanks losing to Burkett, especially with Pettite pitching...Cubbies look like they're wrapping it up. Six more outs for the Fish. So I will be joining the workforce again on Thursday-filling out W-4s and I-9s and all that jazz. I am ecstatic to be employed again, well at least more than just every Saturday. Good times. Oh yeah, yesterday was Columbus Day(the day it's observed). I remember always having off from school, at least until I reached college. Yesterday I noticed that my old elementary school was in session. What is this world coming to? First they condensed Washington & Lincoln's birthdays into one day, then they stopped observing Veteran's Day in school, and now Columbus day isn't a day off anymore. What's next? No more Christmas break!

Hello all. The crazy New Jersey weather of 40 degrees one day and 70 the next has finally gotten to me.. I'm sick. I'm not sure but maybe it's a punishment from the party the other night. Probably not. I only had three drinks... Anyhoo, I'm on day 2 of my cold which basically means I must suffer for the next week and a half. I'm no good at being sick. I turn into a whiney little baby. And guess what? Mommy isn't home to take care of me. What fun is being sick if there's no one to wait on you?
Skee-Lo "I wish" - There's pretty much no way I could ever forget that. I'm kinda psyched for the Strokes as well. -Rob

Jeez, Den, you sound like a professional writer for Rolling Stone. I'll take it! There's this house around the corner from mine which stations a small dog that I'd like to kick. It tends to poop on the sidewalk, and the owners don't ever clean it up. Today when I was walking by, I noticed, ironically, that their house had been tp'd. Well done! Man am I bored. I'm literally counting down the hours until this party. I'm about to start drinking now. Whoops, too late.

Hello all, During work, I listen Virgin radio UK on the Internet while I'm at my computer. Normally it is a good station, lots of great Brit rock, except for a band called The Darkness. You gotta hear them. They are like an 80's hair band and their video is pretty fucking hysterical, which you can see for free at Rollingstone.com. There's a guitar solo in it, where the guitarist is surrounded by a wall of amps. Pure 80's metal. Surprising to me they are #1 in the UK for the past month. Anyway, on to good music. The Strokes new album comes out in 2 weeks. So far, it has gotten pretty good reviews and I'm looking forward to it. This year has seen some killer releases, new Radiohead, White Stripes, Stephen Malkmus (of Pavement fame), Doug Martsch (of Built to Spill), and the Strokes. The Strokes and White Stripes may be a little mainstream for some, but they both play great music and they get kids into such bands like the Velvet Underground and Televison, which is always a plus. Radiohead is simply one of the best bands out today. Amazing live performances, intelligent lyrics, and arguably the best musicians in any band. There's my little rant on music for today. Yankees 6 Red Sox 2, Series tied 1-1, Clemens vs. Martinez at Fenway on Saturday. As a baseball fan, it doesn't get any better than this!! Have a good weekend all!
Hey I remember urlLink Disorderlies . The Fat Boys were funny back in da day...

"Every day would be a Friday, and we could even speed down the highway." If you know what song or artist this quote is from, then you win. So I'm gonna speed down the highway today because it's Friday, and tonight I'm gonna exit that highway to go to Mr. Sides' house. Once there, we will be partaking in the imbibing of alcohol. Woo! And on top of that, it's pizza nite beforehand! Tomorrow I work for GHT, so what usually happens when I work for them? Well, apparently it's not supposed to rain tomorrow. Ho-ly Crap. That's incredible. Unfortunately, the game doesn't begin until 2pm because of the kids taking SATs tomorrow. I won't be home until 7 probably. So no Saturday, but that's where tonite is important! Sunday, Sunday, Sunday! I will be seeing about this job opportunity. Hopefully all goes well and I'd be able to start soon after. I have to fill out when of those apps on the computer, and then I gotta pee in a cup so they know I'm not addicted to meth. Here's a story I'd like to share which highlights my job search experience. Last Friday I received a phone call from urlLink Belleville . The secretary says they're going to be interviewing for two 5th grade positions. I say I am interested and she says the interviews would be later next week, but she would call early in the week to schedule. So I wait, and she doesn't call. So yesterday(Thursday!) I call them. She says they didn't interview yet, and she's not sure when they will be. So I say, well will it be within the next few months? She says she doesn't know, but probably. So I ask will I still be on the interview list if they don't interview for another 3 months, and she says, "probably." OK, then why did you call me last week? This is just one of the many examples of ineptness in New Jersey's School Districts. Absolutely disorganized. Remember the movie Disorderlies ? No one does. Never mind. So this urlLink AIM thing is addictive. I don't even have many buddy names, and I'm thinking I'm on way too much. But it's quite fun, especially when you sign on at midnight last nite to check your email, and end up chatting with Liz until 1. Don't worry. Liz is Kim's friend, not some girl I met in a chatroom. Anyway, I'm currently talking to Kev while he's working. I feel kinda bad, but he says it's all good and he won't get in trouble. Well folks, enjoy your weekend.
