Dude, you'll never guess what happened last night. I was at the Town Pub watching the Cubs-Marlins game and noticed these two odd characters. One guy was dressed in this long coat with boots and had a fisherman-type hat on and the guy he was sitting next to had this pirate theme. He had this long mustache and goatee. Anyway, The pirate guy was mackin' on some chick. The fisherman guy comes back from the bathroom to sit down and trips on the pirates pegleg. The fisherman falls into the chick and she falls down with him on top of her. She hits him and pushes him away and stormed out onto Broad Street. The pirate guy is pissed and starts whaling on the fisherman and swearing about how he always prevents him from getting any box. More punches were exchanged before a big dude from the back came out to separate them. The bartender called for a cab to bring the fisherman home, and the pirate guy had to drive home. Chaos. That was something you don't see every day, unless it was Halloween or something, but that's a few weeks away still. Anyway, the Cubs destroyed the fish. And the Sox were victorious as well. Their bullpen looked pretty sharp, at least Timlin and Williamson. Hope both series continue to be close, though. You know what I had for breakfast this morning? Cinnamon Toast Crunch. I never had the stuff when I was a kid, but I'm eating it when I'm 24. I ate after mowing the lawn, which is especially fun when there's pieces of metal hidden in the yard from the guy next door's construction. It was like mowing over a mine field. Try not to get electrocuted or get a contusion on your shin. So on Sunday, I may have a job. It's not a teaching job, but where has that profession gotten me, honestly? Kim 's mom is hooking me up with a job full-time. She said it would be like an inventory dude and i'd be on the floor as well, but it's a job and I couldn't be happier. I just hope something stupid doesn't happen between now and Sunday. So I'm happy, and I'm sorry about all the nagging and depression I've emitted the last few months on the blog. I hope you understood a little of my feelings, but I think I was a little overboard, so things are looking up! Oh, remember when I mentioned something positive happening with my brother? Well, he's gonna be working at WFAN, probably the biggest sports radio station in the US, on a patchy basis. He's happy as hell, and he's still gonna be at WCBS 880 as well. Good stuff. May blog again later. Peace out.

Hello all! I just got home from class and I'm saving Loses Control to my computer. The weird thing is that my Real One Player actually "knew" who Hey Mercedes was and had all the tracks listed for me so I don't have to type everything in.. Nice! I think the boys have finaly made the big time. This album is awesome and EVERYONE should own it. Bob actually says fuck several times in one song. I've neverheard fuck sound so pretty. It made me wonder if fuck is a really a bad word. I haven't seen any butterflies either Rob, but I have seen some nice sunrises sitting in my car on campus at 6:30 am... Wow. That's really early.
Me thinks me going to see me ol' friend Captain Morgan tonite. Drinking rum, singing pirate songs, lootin', and lookin' for some ass. I hope he can pick me up cuz I don't have a carrrrrr.

Well, politics is officially a joke in this country. Arnold Shwarzenegger is going to be governor of California, but strangely, I'm jealous. I think it's because he couldn't do any worse of a job than Gov. McGreevey has done for this state. Yeah that guy sucks. Don't pass it to that guy. Did anyone see the game last night? Holy crap was that exciting. Cubbies have a must-win tonite... Yeah, so I just downloaded aim, so if you have it, my name is urlLink stringmule . I have no job, folks, give me something to do. Not like you care, but I'm going to write a brief synopsis of the new urlLink Hey Mercedes album entitled Loses Control . These are my interpretations of the songs so far, so they may not even be close to the real meanings! The artwork and photography are nice as well. 01 Quality Revenge At Last Lyric: There's a phone call coming from a Romeo in Joliet Catchy song with some "Yeah's" in the chorus-probably most radio friendly I guess 02 It's Been A Blast Lyric: All the arguments are not the same without you Most uptempo on CD in my opinion. About a past fling he is looking back on. 03 Playing Your Song Lyric: The lies are piling up so high that he can't sleep at night Third person story about a guy who is with a girl but loves another. 04 Knowing When To Stop Lyric: There's nothing inspirational like watching angels drop The downfall of frienship through lies and fights. 05 The Boy Destroyers Lyric: All I know is I'm never gonna go the safe way home Loneliness. 06 Unorchestrated Lyric: The point in time when everything dies. It's over. Sad song. Depression to realizing things are not so bad. 07 Lashing Out Lyric: Smile and sing along to every single song Singing along to some band at a show. 08 Police Police Me Lyric: The stars are all smiling. It's disarming. Media, cops, and criminals are all the same. 09 Oh Penny Lyric: And my dear old sharona keeps em on the floor wanting more Happiness with someone elsewhere, but Penny is here now. 10 The Switch Lyric: I'm a nervous wreck. Hey I'm a tightrope. Sex compared to a video game? Huh? High score...if it takes all night. 11 Absolute Zero Drive Lyric: So wake up soldiers and take all your arms and leave My favorite song. No fear, man. 12 Go On Drone Lyric: Stop the press. Who is that mess? Miserable person continues to mope.
Never fear Kevin. You can always just root against my teams as usual.

Well, its 9am and I've been at work for 2 and a half hours now, and I don't feel like doing any work. So, here's what I've been up to for the past week: I took the urlLink girlfriend to see Howie Day at Irving Plaza last Thursday. Jump, Little Children (now going by the moniker "Jump") opened and were rather good. They played a good mix of old and new songs. Then Howie went on. He was good, but nothing special. I really didn't see anything that would separate him from the other thousand singer/songwriters out right now. The gf loved it, so I guess the nite was a success. At least I got to see my friend Pete at the show. I took Friday off from work, since we got back from the show at 3:30am. I spent the day dicking with my car. And then I completely wasted Saturday. On Sunday, myself and 3 of my friends took two cars up to Vermont and we spent the day rallying our cars on the unpaved mountain roads of VT and Upstate NY. It was a blast. My car is completely filthy. The only negative about the day is that we left at 9am and didn't get back until 9:30pm, so I spent 12 hours driving on a Sunday. Needless to say, I was absolutely worthless at work on Monday; but it's not like I care. It's sad, but I think I've become disenchanted with sports. I really don't care if the Yankees win or lose, I've given up on the New Orleans Saints, I gave up on the New York Rangers years ago, and I never gave a shit about basketball. I still love watching sports, but I can't rout for anyone like I used to. Oh well Later

Who the hell is Captain McCallister? Is that the pirate on the Simpsons? Anyway, I worked tonight during the Red Sox game. Not suprisingly, there were no movie-goers in Boston. We were getting updates continuously. This guy Justin jumped on top of me when they won. The streets filled with people. This city loves its teams, its scary and admirable. I've been on record since July saying the Sox would win it this year, as there's quite a bit of something to this team. That said, as a yanks fan, I predict Yanks in 4 for the pennant. I know it doesn't make sense. Regarding the Pats, they're gritty. They only play well when they're dogs. I have this sneaking suspicion that Belichick cut Milloy to motivate the team. With 5 of their top 8 players on the defensive front out, the defense has been superb this year. It doesn't show in the numbers necessarily, but the defense is as good as its been in 4 years. The red zone D is solid. All the young kids on defense, Wilson (now a safety), Samuel, Klecko, and Warren have all been productive. The offense is its non-flashy 'try not to turn the ball over' self. I expect many close games this year again. I think they beat the Gaints this week on a very good week from Brady and the receivers. Truthfully, Shockey matches up well against the Pats D as all TEs do, but I think they'll do something to compensate in turnovers and special teams. NE over NYG 28-20. Non-sports, I've been working alot. I havent seen many pretty butterflies or sunsets. My project is moving slowly due to my lack of time. However, I'm still paying my rent, barely. I think I'm going to listen to the Strokes and sleep tonight. Blog it!
Y'arr!

Hi everybody again. So I am bored and decided to blog again. I wrote three new songs today, so visit my urlLink site . I received my copy of the new Hey Mercedes CD, and it is quite enjoyable, as expected. More on that perhaps tomorrow after a few more listens. The first song is about the daily grind, and can be found urlLink here , while the second song, about the upcoming season, can be found urlLink here , and the final one, written mainly for Kim can be found urlLink here .

Hello all! Long time, no blog. I've been busy with school, work and Brian which leaves me no time to blog. Football this. Baseball that. As the only female on this blog I say screw that shizzle! Talk about more important things like butterflies and beautiful sunsets. Wha? As proven by my prior statement, I am not really into sports but I did catch some of the Giants game with Brian on Sunday and they made some pretty miserable calls. Shockey was not taunting.. He was simply trying to get that guy off of him and the ball slipped. See what having a reputation can get you? Where has everyone been? I guess I'm not the only one not blogging..

I think I'm going to stop making predictions before I realize how utterly ridiculous I feel. Does that even make sense? Anyway, I said the Bengals would win outright, but they lost in OT. I still don't think Buffalo is all that good though. All of Bledsoe's passing yards came after CB Jeff Burris left the field on a stretcher, and Eric Moulds was covered by a scrub. Yeah, it was the key time to start getting yards, but still, they were lucky because he had 102 yards midway thru the 4th quarter... I said last week the Red Sox weak link in the lineup was the leadoff spot, which is Johnny Damon. I like Damon, but I just felt he'd been so inconsistent during the year, and yesterday he hits a 2 run homer. I really hope the Sox win because I want them to beat the Yankees. I know just about everyone here likes the Yankees, but I don't, and frankly I'm sick of them. After the game, they decide to interview Jeter surprisingly. Why? He hit a meaningless solo HR? How about naming Nick Johnson or Matsui player of the game when their 2-run hits mattered in the game, or maybe even fat David Wells for pitching [sigh] another important game in the postseason. Anyway, it's Pedro vs. Zito tonite, and the Sox need a big game from everyone, but it's time for Kevin Millar to step it up. urlLink Tomorrow is the day! Oh yeah, how about those Cubbies? Giants: check; Braves: check; Yankees: not yet. Hey 2 out of 3 gone from the playoffs is a great start. I think I'm going to root for the Cubs, but I will not be saddened if the Marlins win. Hey Rob-what's the deal with New England? Their a strange team. Blown out by Buffalo. Blow out Philly. Eek by the Jets. Get eeked out by Washington. Out-gun Tennessee. What's the pattern here? Do they get out-gunned by the Giants next week? God I hope not. The Giants are so boring. Big changes may be in the works for my brother. Good changes. Hopefully after tomorrow things will be fit to brag about. I have an interview later this week urlLink here . They have two 5th grade openings, so we'll see what happens there.

Welcome, weekend. I'm still wondering where the end of summer went, but anyway, it's still nice out today. I got a haircut this morning from the lovely amateurs at Supercuts . The girl I had today is usually pretty good, but she always cuts the back crooked-like, so I have to fix it. It's fine if it's a little bit off, then I wouldn't care, but when it visibly slopes downward to the left, it looks sorta funny. I went to the bank to attempt to cash my check from GHT, but there was a line out the door full of old people. It must be social security check day. Yup, it's the 3rd of the month, so I left because I probably would still be there since 10:30. I'm listening to Cursive right now. This is a very strange but good cd. It has organs and cellos in abundance. Very eerie. My Red Sox prediction was wrong. Boy do they suck. How can they not score with that lineup. Their lineup reminds me of an even better than the Jays of 93. They have really no weak link, except for maybe in leadoff. I guess pitching does win games, and their bullpen bites it big time. Pizza night. Tomorrow it's supposed to rain because we have a game to do. I realized even more that I hate the South. Folks in Richmond refused to name a street after tennis legend Arthur Ashe because of his skin color. Fucking muffs. Go buy a clue instead of a confederate flag.

Hey folks, sorry for the long absence on my part. My computer was diseased and being repaired for a few days, so I was without this piece of technology. Let's take a look back to my weekend predictions from last Thursday. The Bengals won, so that was nice, and Syracuse kicked Toledo's ass, which surprised me. Either the Cuse is much better this year, or Toledo got lucky beating Pitt. Anyway, Walter Reyes is one of the top backs in the nation, so I'm happy with their 3-1 start. Did ya see my boy Shannon Stewart on Tuesday? I know you probably did, but I had to rub it in a bit to the Yankee fans. Also, I hope Arod doesn't win MVP because the (Texas) Rangers suck. I also don't want Tejada to even get mentioned because he can suck my ass too. If it's going to be a Yankee, then I hope it's Posada. As long as Halladay gets his hardware. Let's look ahead to this weekend. Starting today, I hope they don't but I think the Yankees will win game 2, as well as the Sox. On Sunday, the Bengals are at Buffalo, which is not good. Takeo Spikes may decapitate anyone he tackles, and Corey Dillon is not playing. However, Travis Henry is questionable, and may not play. I'm gonna be bold and say the Bengals win again. Call me crazy, but I have renewed faith in Jon Kitna and his receivers. And I also don't think Buffalo is as good as I thought when the season started, especially after watching them the last 2 games. I went on an interview yesterday for a teaching job, but couldn't tell you how I did, because the principal showed no emotion during the time I was there. I'm supposed to find out by Weds if I made the final 4. I saw my professor yesterday for a reference for grad school, so now I am done with my application process. So now I wait to see if I get in. I got a letter yesterday telling me I was denied for financial aid, but I don't know why there was no mention of loans. I have to call the financial aid office to figure out what the deal is. On a delayed realization, I noticed it's October. It didn't gradually get cooler, like ease into the low 70s or hi 60s, but it just became 60 and dropped into the 40s overnight. What happened to the light jacket at night weather? It's already feeling like hoodie weather. Hey Den, what gives the hotel the right to call itself a "historic bordello?" Was Lincoln a customer? How about those Scarlet Knights, huh? Putting up 30 a game. Oh by the way William Paterson lost last weekend 67-0.

It was nice seeing everyone last night, but we really missed Garet. Anyway, it was cool catching up at dinner and going to the fabled Town Pub for their good grog. We didn't see the folks we wanted to, but instead saw a couple of handfuls of high school classmates, most of which we didn't say a word to. No real loss there. One interesting note, however, was that the Crow walked into the bar at about 10. He emitted a cold wall around him and sat down at the bar. There was eerily a seat on either side of him unoccupied. If everyone comes home again for Christmas, we should try to get out again, hopefully to a better eatery, and plan ahead a bit so my work schedule doesn't screw up the meeting time. In other news, I realized I didn't ask anyone how their Thanksgiving was yesterday, so hopefully all went well, and hopefully Matt's trip to FL went smoothly...The Cuse plays RU today. They'll probably lose, but even if they win, they probably won't get into a bowl game, which sucks because even though their record is not very good, they have a great runner and a pretty good qb that the nation should see. Anyway, the Sixers remain in 1st despite their paltry 8-9 record. It's windy today and I arrived at the conclusion that if it's not raining, then it's windy. One thing that made me feel better about myself: I read in the paper that people were waiting in parking lots of stores yesterday at 1 am for the stores to open at 5 am. I wasn't one of those people, and never will be.

Hello again, May I begin by telling Kim that your advisor appears to be an idiot. It's unfortunate when someone that is supposed to be helping you with your scholastic career never really takes the time to get to know you or at least look at your records and see what kind of student you are. Today was probably my most frustrating day at work yet. My supervisor has taken half days all this week, which isn't bad, except we've gotten hit with all sorts of new admissions, and while working with brain injured folks sounds like the most fun you could have ever, there are times when it can be a little bit tiresome. Just have to get through tomorrow though. I hope everyone's travels go smoothly and safely. Oh yeah, say hello to Bill at the Town Pub for me.

Hello everyone, I'll be flying home tomorrow for Thanksgiving. Friday sounds like a good day to meet up. I'll talk to the other half tonight and see what she says. We can do the Alexus thing again like last winter break or just hang with Jarrett and Bill Rupp at the Town Pub.

That stuff is messed up, Kim. I hope the Dean gets things straightened out. I think everyone should be given an opportunity to do what they want, regardless of what people think you can do. This is ignoring the obvious fact that he's a dope who should see you're well prepared and have a better chance of success than the vast majority of people. So why he thinks you can't succeed is pretty much a mystery to me, and somewhat mindblowing. Anyhow, I'm comng to NJ for Thanksgiving. I'm taking a greyhound in the middle of the night from Boston tonight. I'll be in tommorrow morning. It'll be good. I'll call you Bri to see if we can meet sometime. Blog out. Happy Thanksgiving.

So here's the update on my "What Should My Major Be?!?" saga... I went to see my advisor today and he told me I was stupid. Well not in those words really. I asked him if the math class I was taking now could possibly count as a precal class and he said no way. Ok. Fine. Whatever. He then told me that I was not smart enough to take a Calculus class. What the fuck?!? I don't mean to sound conceited, but does he have any clue who he is talking to? I graduated high school with advanced calc. I have pulled nothing but A's in all of my math classes to date. I have a 3.8 GPA for crying out loud!! He has some fucking nerve to say I'm not smart enough. However, I did not say this to him to his face because I like to avoid confrontation at any cost. Anyways, I sent an e-mail to the dean and told him what happened. I wasn't mean to him at all but I did get my point across. Let's see if this guy replies. I know nothing will probably happen. He'll tell me that he thinks I should talk to my advisor about what happened and work things out amongst ourselves. It's also my word against the advisor's. Guess who's side they'll take? (Hint: It won't be mine) This event has given me yet another reason to complain about Montclair. Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad school but Stevens looks more and more tempting as the asses at Montclair continue to be.. well.. asses!

Well, nothing new from the void known as Connecticut. The gf and I saw Lost in Translation on Friday. I loved it. I had lunch in Boston on Saturday and did absolutely nothing but watch sports on Sunday. I actually got to see the Rangers win a game... This short week can't go fast enough. I need to get out of here for awhile. I will be in Bloomfield until Saturday morning, so I am game for dinner/drinks/whatever on Friday nite.

I'm counting down the days until Thanksgiving. I'm off on turkey day, work Friday, and then I'm off Sat & Sunday. That's nice, except for Friday, but anyway. If you actually are still coming home this weekend, perhaps we can do something Friday after I work(7 pm). I have one of those throw-away cameras left over from vacation to Myrtle Beach. Maybe I should finish it this weekend, since it's been sitting here on the desk for 4 months. I also want to use my digital camera a bit, since I haven't been using that much either lately. Hopefully I'll be hearing good news either today or tomorrow. Montclair said I should know within a week, and today is a week. In something related to school, my chiropractor told me I should sub again. He says I should pick somewhere I want to work, get on the sub list and hopefully something will open up. He says I'm young and healthy, so I should wing it for a while without insurance. It sounds like a great possibility, however, I did this already earlier this year at Clifton and Livingston, and they didn't hire me back. I also don't particularly like subbing, since it's like starting a new job every day. I'll probably see after the new year, if I can last at my job until then. I think I may be developing a cold(surprise), so I'm trying to drink lots and take extra vitamins and such. Who knows if anything really helps. I tried getting some sleep, but I can't seem to sleep late anymore. Gotta be at work in about 3 hours, so I'm not too thrilled about that, except I won't have to watch the Giants-Bucs game tonite. Gross.

Elf was a pretty good movie. Perfect for the holidays and Will Ferrell was perfect for that part. I couldn't really think of anyone who could have done a better job than him. I would recommend it to all. So after some thinking, I think I'm going to stick to being a math major. I had this epiphany in the middle of my Accounting class on Thursday morning. As the professor was explaining how to journalize bed debt expenses, I thought to myself, "Wow. This shit really sucks. I have no desire to do this for the rest of my life. It's just so freakin' boring." So, after I had this change of heart, I made an appointment with my advisor for Monday in hopes he can answer some questions about scheduling for me. I have some good news! I spoke to my Calc professor on Thursday night and we were talking about my change to a math major. I was planning on asking him about a possible internship of sorts at his company. The guy beats me to it and comes right out and says, "I would love to give you a job." Well thats fine by me! I would start in January or February as a financial planner in training. If that's what you want to call it. He said the job is pretty fast paced and intense. This is ok with me since I do absolutely nothing where I work now. The only downside is that the job is in NYC. Oh well. I'll get over it. Now it's time for me to get ready to go to Red Lobster. Mmmm.. Cheddar bay biscuits, cesaer salad, and lots of garlic-y shrimp.

It's a rare weekend blog. I couldn't sleep as late as I had planned, so I went surfing this morning. I found the Sixers lost to the Knicks last nite. Wha? I deleted my 60 junk mails. I decided to blog because I'm bored. Last nite, Kim & I saw Elf . It was pretty funny. It wasn't exactly what I was expecting, though. I didn't know what to expect, actually, but I figured it would be more of a Will Ferrell-type comedy, and it was more of a cutesy-type of comedy. It had some extremely funny parts, all while staying with relatively clean humor. To make it better, the Allwood theater dropped their ticket prices back down to $6 from $8. That was nice. Today I'm going to lunch with Kim and her mother. Red Lobster is our destination, and we haven't been there in a while. I'm sure we'll have to wait 3 hours from all the damn religious people going there after chuch. Since my fiasco on Thursday nite, the Vandals have gone 2-1. I replayed my game with Philly and lost a heartbreaker 28-21. I then rattled off 2 in a row with wins over the first place Jets(Wha?) and Patriots. I smushed the Jets' rushing attack, and had a nice game with newly acquired starting QB Jeff Blake. He was acquired for Chris Chandler and Larry Centers. I then had a good rushing game from Brian Westbrook against New England. His first carry went 79 yards for a TD and tied the game after the Pats opening game drive, which resulted in a David Patten TD reception. I ended up actually holding NE on a few drives, which is the first time I was able to play good defense(or maybe they just played poor offense, but whatever). Anywho, I'm 2-2 now and sitting in a tie for second in the AFC East.

I've got to tackle a few things before the week ends. First, my brother was on tv, as Den mentioned, because he has been a fill-in for WFAN doing the 20/20 sports flash. He was on tv because the YES network airs Mike & the Maddog, and he was doing the flash during that time slot. It's pretty cool hearing him... Next, Montclair found my scores. They actually found them the same day I blogged, but I hadn't had time to blog. More incompetence in this world... Third, I purchased a new game for my PS2(I know have 3 games!). I got NFL Gameday 2004 just yesterday. It's pretty hard so far. I played one game with the Bengals yesterday and got obliterated, but I didn't get mad because I knew I would suck. I decided to play another game to see if maybe I got the hang of it, but ended up turning it off in the first quarter. I read the instruction booklet fully and found the game has a cool feature in which you can create your own expansion team-design the uniform, logo, etc. Pretty cool! So I created the NJ Vandals with some bad-ass brown uni's and a pirate-type logo on the helmet. Anyway, there's an expansion draft where you select the rubbish left unprotected by the current NFL teams. It was pretty realistic because the people available were horrible. I can list my "stars" of the team: Brian Westbrook, Chad Morton, Freddie Mitchell, Willie McGinest, and Darrien Gordon. Ugh. My QBs are Brooks Bollinger, Chris Chandler, and Scott Covington. Who? Yeah. So I did my draft and played a game and got beat by the Texans, but hung tough. I think I lost 31-21. It's very difficult to pass, because the controls are sensitive, plus Brooks Bollinger is my QB, remember? I decide to play game 2 against the Eagles. They score on the first play-a 80 some odd yard pass to James Thrash. Once they get past your LBs, they're gone. Slowness. I get the ball and start running the shit out of it. Westbrook had 170 yards, Lamont Warren had 130, and Dee Brown had 40. I couldn't stop them, plus they had a KR, but when I kept running, the game stayed close. I'm down 21-10 at half. Get the ball to start the 3rd, and continue running and hold the ball for 4 of the 5 minutes in the quarter before hitting Freddie Mitchell with a 5 yard slant for a TD. Lamont Warren up the middle gets me 2. 21-18. They come back and score in less than 2 minutes because Jon Ritchie is faster than my team. Anyway, roughly 4 minutes left in the game. I know I can win. I've been running all day, so if I eat up the clock and get down there, I can at least tie it and not let them get much time. I run and run and run and punch it in with 15 seconds left. You're thinking, "He's still gonna lose somehow." Wrong, I hold on to win! Woo! First win for the Vandals. Post-game, I'm checking out my roster to see if there are any free agents, and the game freezes. My victory is gone, my 400 rush yards gone. Man was I pissed. So that long ass blog you just read technically does not exist. Sorry. So the game is pretty fun at least when you can eat the clock. Otherwise, I would be destroyed. Totally bummed about the lost info, man. I may try to play again before bed if I don't fall asleep. Peace out.

Hi to everyone, even Dennis. I'm in lab right now, basically struggling to stop myself from running far far away. Optical alignment I don't like. Honestly, there isn't much lab work I actually do like. Anyhow, I used to do it pretty well, so I'll get used to it again. Anyhow, my project is starting to take shape, though finishing it in time might mean not coming home for Thanksgiving. I have quite a bit to do, and not alot of time left, as my productivity most of this semester has been... not ideal. I'll keep you posted about next week. Go Bengals! Jon Kitna and Johnson and Johnson and Johnson are good stuff. They've got a good shot at winning the division if they can get through this tough road stretch with 2 victories. The division is theirs if they can. I'm just happy seeing them play competitive ball again. I'm also happy that the Steelers and Raiders blow. I've also never been much of a Miami fan, not terribly suprising. I can see the Pats making the playoffs as possible this year, which is really all I can ask as a fan. Since they've actually won a superbowl, i'd like the franchise to stay solid for a little while to make the championship look more valid. Anyway, I think Eugene Wilson might be my new favorite player. I know probably nobody else gets to watch him, but as a corner turned safety, he's done everything pretty well, including tackling and especially hitting. Those are only noteworthy when considering that he can cover as well as a cornerback too. Enough football. Basketball, I think I'm the only person not super surprised that the Bucks are actually ok. The talent level isn't the greatest, but at least they have some youth and no super-egos destroying any sense of team. See ya later Mason (aka the worst thing to happen to professional basketball ever) Ummm..... gonna go do some work now or something. Blog out

Hey Brian. Congrats to your brother and the Bengals! My parents saw him on TV yesterday and the Bengals are in 1st place at the end of November (crazy). At least they are more exciting to watch then the Dolphins. As for the Nets, the slow start is bothersome, but Boston is only 5-5 in 1st place and as far as I am concerned the Celtic can't compete with the Nets. The Western Conference is once again loaded, so I wsih the Nets would start playing to thier expectations. it's funny how two straight trips to the Finals makes someone want more. 5 years ago, I was content with a playoff berth. Well, I'm off to watch The Towers: Extended Edition See you in about 4 hours!

Just stopping by to pass on a tidbit of information. If any of you miss Opie & Anthony, go to urlLink www.live365.com and search for a station called WHIV. They play nothing but whole O&A shows. You will have to register for the site, but it's free and worth it to hear O&A again, even if they are repeats.

Well, I'm back earlier than expected to complain. I called urlLink Montclair State this morning to find out my status of my application. They tell me they never received my GRE scores. Wow, that's great! I emailed them 2 weeks ago to make sure they had all my info, and they never emailed me back. So I call ETS to make sure they sent the scores to the right address and confirmed the scores were sent on October 3rd to the exact address the guy gave me at Montclair. "They could have been lost in the mail," he says. Well that's great, but maybe you could have told me about this so I haven't been waiting for 2 months for nothing. So know they're "checking" the office and are supposed to call me back, yeah right. UN-FUCKING-BELIEVABLE! Forget about the Red Sox and the curse of the bambino. My name is cursed. I'll probably find out that the 100 resumes I sent out have been "lost in the mail" as well. Oh yeah, I wanted to sleep a bit today, but was scared out of my sleep when two cars crashed directly outside my window at 6:30 this morning. Well, I got my haircut, so that's something I wanted to do.

Wow, it was like a friggin' reunion here on the blogger. Everyone checked in. What a nice surprise. Den-thank you for the in-depth retrospective on your journey to N'awleans. Bam! Kev-thank you for your input on the Matrix, however, I still don't plan on seeing it. Matt-thank you for checking in and giving me my vacation destination for 2004. Warm Springs, here we come! Rob-thank you for your predictions.(Cincy 28, KC 20=really damn close) As for those Bengals, how about the team actually being .500 in November, and to better that feat, they are in first friggin' place! Rudi Johnson again comes up big with 160 yards rushing. Jon Kitna threw zero INTs, and Peter Warrick is developing into the player he was at Florida State. Good things come to those who wait, and I've waited 14 years. Suddenly, the playoffs are not far off from reality, but I will not be disappointed if they finish with a .500 record and fail to make the playoffs. They are playing close and their offense is scoring. They'd probably be fun to watch, but lord knows we can't see the Bengals on television, only Jets and Giants. No bathroom, only Klau Kulash. Tomorrow I return to working my Monday nite shift. Woo boy am I excited. The only positive thing that may come out of that is if I am able to get my haircut tomorrow morning before work. I have a shaggy dog atop my cranium, and it's no fun. I gotta call Montclair to see what's up with grad school as well. I haven't heard a peep, and they never responded to my email from 2 weeks ago. If time remains, I have to clean out the trunk of my car. It tends to leak. Not like "Oh, it's a bit damp from the monsoon we just encountered." More like "Oh, there's a swamp forming under my spare tire and there's some wildlife inhabiting the pond." My tire jack is rusted, as is my tire iron. The rim of my spare is rusted a bit, and there's a slime on the tire itself. Not a pretty sight or smell. I discarded the carpet at the end of the summer because it was ruined, and now I don't want the entire trunk to rust through. In other news, I realized I have an abundance of cds I never listen to, and probably never will because I don't like them. I have an urge to buy some new ones, but I haven't had much luck in buying stuff that I'm unfamiliar with. I may go browse around right now actually, since I'm not too tired. I'll be back probably mid-week to whine about work I'm sure and maybe other things that are pissing me off. Here's a possible preview: traffic, weather, the Rangers, my paycheck.

Hello all, Back from New Orleans. Great food; oysters, shrimp, catfish, po boys, bread pudding, all spicy!! The conference was good too. Over 30,000 neuroscientists. I actually had a Nobel laureate stop by my poster and tell me I was a doing a good job. FYI, the Nobel Prize is equivalent to making the Hall of Fame for science. That was pretty exciting. Now, time to explain the nightlife. Day 1-Head to Bourbon St. Immediately stop by Patty O'Brien's for some hand grenades (from Kev's recommendation). After 4 hand grenades, I realize I am extremely drunk. Walk down Bourbon St and see some great sights from the ladies (hint hint) at the balcony of the Sonesta hotel. Have 2 more hurricanes and proceed to dry heave in my hotel. Pass out on the bathroom and wake up at 12. Day 2-Wake up at noon and get lunch. After the conference, we decide to go to Harrah's for drinks and gambling. I played blackjack for a while and win $140. Of course we have to celebrate. Enter Bourbon St. After another blur of a night, we get back to our hotel at 4:30. Sleep for a few hours then go to the conference Day 3-After the conference, we head to Cafe Du Monde for some chickory coffee and beignets. After a tasty meal, I go back for an early sleep since I have to present my data the next day. BTW, we stop by Harrah's and I lose $20 Day 4-Poster session went awesome. I had a lot of important people in the field check out my data and I got a lot of positive feedback. My old boss was there and she took me out to Nola's (Emeril's restaurant) for lunch. I had some awesome gumbo and jambayla. We then go to the Acme Oyster Bar for dinner. After shucking lots of oysters, we hang out on Bourbon St once again. I stick to Abita beer and have a good time. BTW, we stop by Harrah's and I lose $20 (notice a pattern here) Day 5-Grad students from the Univ of Colorado-Boulder have a huge house party in the Garden District. Big mansion and lots of free beer Stay there until 4 and come back. On1y 1 day left in the Big Easy :( BTW, we stop by Harrah's and I lose $20. Day 6-Last day in New Orleans. We have a lesiurely day and night, since we are all flying out early the next day. All the guys in my program decide to stop by the Barely Legal club for some entertainment, which was very interesting. BTW, we stop by Harrahs, and I come out even!!!! Day 7-Say goodbye to New Orleans. All in all, a great trip!! Thanks to UNC for picking up the tab!! Anyway, I will be back for Thanksgiving from Wed-Mon, if anyone wants to hang out (even Rob) Kevin-thanks for telling me what to drink in N.O. (my stomach does not thank you though) Finally, as for school. In my situation, I started off in science and wanted to go to med school. I realized that I didn't want to do it and ended up in psychology. I then decided psych was not enough since everyone has psych degrees. I then worked in a lab and sort of went back to biology. Now I enjoy what I do. I look at behavior and what goes on in the brain. So I basically combined psych and bio together. Basically, maybe combine math and business and become a consultant. That way, you get money and enjoy what you do. Wow, that was a big blog for me! Talk to everyone latter, have a good weekend!!
Minor addendum: The best part about Revolutions was the trailer for The Punisher .

Good bloggy morning to you all. As promised, I am back with my review of Matrix: Revolutions . Here goes: It wasnt all that bad. I would say it was better than Reloaded . They left out a major portion of the philosophy that killed Reloaded . This was more of a straight forward action movie. Per usual, the movie was visually stunning and the acting was atrocious. It gives good closure to the trilogy. My only major complaint, other than the acting or dialogue, was the fact that in order to understand the movie completely you have to see the first and second movies, plus the Animatrix and the end of the Matrix video game. All in all, I would not recommend you run out and see it immediately; but I would not try and dissuade you from seeing it if you told me you were planning to do so. And I guess I will add my $0.02 to the whole Stevens/major/life thing. As for Rob's comments on Stevens, I agree with all of them except for the part about the established programs versus the small programs. I was in an established program (mechanical engineering) and there was a lot more bullshit and too much structure in that program. Since it was "established", they basically told you that had to take course A,B, and C and that you could choose one or two "electives" from a list of courses X,Y,and Z. There was basically zero leeway in making your schedule. Where as the smaller majors had a lot more flexibility in their scheduling, but that puts more pressure on the student to make good decisions. Wherever you were to go school, just make sure that you major in something you truly enjoy. I majored in something that I was proficient in, not necessarily something I really like. That was probably my biggest mistake. I thought about job opportunities and compared that to what I was good at, and that's how I came up with my major. Not a good way to do it. My best suggestion to any one still in school is to find an internship at a place that would be similar to the work you would be doing after you graduate; and make sure you enjoy it. You do not want to be stuck the rest of your working life in a career you dont like. That's enough out of me. I hope this day goes by quickly, because Meredith and I are going to see Boston's own, Dropkick Murphys at the Webster Theatre in Hartford. I cant wait. I am almost as giddy as a school girl...

Greetings and Salutations, I am currently even further south, residing in Warm Springs, Georgia, and yes, as small as you can imagine the town to be, it's even smaller. I have to drive about 15 minutes to get cell phone reception and to do any grocery shopping. The rehab hospital I'm interning at is pretty cool though, and there are plenty of other interns around so it's not terribly boring all the time. What I do fear is that I will undoubtedly be an alcoholic by the time this internship is over. The last two Fridays, the drinking has started at around 6 pm, only because there is nothing else to do on Friday night, except maybe go to the one of two places in town that sell alcohol and drunkenly sing karaoke along with the locals and their three good teeth and immaculately maintained mullets. Unfortunately, I will not be home for Thanksgiving, I only have Thursday off, so I'm taking a personal day Friday and going down to Florida to see dear old dad. So, no NJ for me until Christmas, I booked my flight yesterday actually. One nice thing about the location, I'm only about an hour and 20 from Atlanta, so I at least can enjoy some good concerts. Went up on Monday and saw Thursday, Thrice, and Coheed and Cambria. It made me happy, even if I had to drive extra slow once I got on the backwoods roads to get back to Warm Springs, first to avoid running over multiple deer and second, I don't want Sheriff Roscoe pulling over my out of state vehicle and have me wind up rotting in some 10'x10' local jail cell for the next 25 years. Big ups to Bri for the Big League Chew reference, it was nice!

Thanks for the input on Stevens. I really do appreciate it. I e-mailed the advisor in the math department at Montclair today to set up an appointment to ask him a few questions. Now all I have to do is sit back and wait for a reply or figure what his office hours are and harass him then. I know I probably won't be 100 percent about what major to take until I'm already working and that is unfortunate but that's the way cookie crumbles. As a matter of fact my current math professor made a very strong suggestion about me working for him in the future. It would defintely be nice to work with him as a financial analyst/advisor. He's an awesome professor (this is my second time taking one of his classes) and he seems to be an all around nice guy. Even if it's just to get some experience I think it would be worthwhile. Well I have to go study some more for a test tomorrow. Thank god there's only 5 weeks left in the semester. But then there's 2 more years to go. Sigh.

I, three will be in Jersey for Thanksgiving, as always. I'm going to be at my brother's house Thurs, and rumor has it my boss wants me in at 6:30 am on Friday, so I shouldn't be working that late on Friday. I don't have a game that Saturday, either, so I'm game for a shindig. I will know more as the time approaches. I also appreciate the input you guys gave to Kim (as I'm sure she appreciates it too). I want her to be happy, but like Rob said, I told her to find out as much as possible about the program, wherever it may be. Kev, the news was on the F2F site, and they emailed me, so I think it's for real. It is really sad. When I got home from work tonite, I wanted to get a haircut. I wanted to call to make sure they were open and there wasn't a wait, and sure enough when I called, I found out they were closed. Supercuts isn't so super are they? I'm trying to figure out when I can go, because I won't have time Saturday morning. I think they open at 9, and I have to leave for work at 9:30. I don't want to work with stray hairs itching my neck all day. As of now, my only option is to go Sunday morning, that is, if they are open. I am so relieved tomorrow is Friday. I just want to chill and not have to wear a tie again until Monday. If I don't be bloggin', then hope y'all have a fun-filled weekend.

Smell ya later? awesome. I feel compelled to comment on Stevens. It is wicked expensive. But mortaging your life away is sometimes feasible with government loans and maybe in state grants. I remember that Kevin and I both ended up with some weird state grant in our financial aid packages. Also, I'm like seriously in debt still, but government loans are more flexible and have lower rates I think. All I know is that i can keep deferring them until I finish school. So, I don't know how practical it is, but still possible. As for the school itself, its a pretty good school, but its still kinda small. The established programs or ones with lots of people (i.e. not physics) are easier to deal with the red tape since there is a better support system. This is something I would have changed if i could go back and do it again. Also, if you really enjoy math, I say go for it wherever you are. Pretty much all technical careers (science, engineering, business, law, accounting, etc.) are going to have boing aspects to them sometimes, if due to nothing else other than the fact that you must deal with practically the issues in front of you, not necessarily the other aspects. It's just that some fields have less of that than others and it really depends on your own personal tastes and interests. Just remember that when dealing with something like your own interests, it never hurts to get as much information as possible. You'll never be 100% certain probably, but you'll get an idea or feeling that might be useful.

Afternoon, ladies and gents, I'll keep this brief... - I hope you're joking about Face to Face, Bri. If they broke up, I am offically saddened. At least I got to see them for the first (and I guess only) time at the Warped Tour this past summer. - Work sucks (but at least I get a paycheck twice a month), and I miss Stevens. Ok, I actually miss Hoboken, but nonetheless... - I love the fact that all of the sports teams I like are mediocre this winter. Is it Spring Training yet? - I will be seeing Matrix:Revolutions tonite with some friends. I am only going because they all want to go and I dont feel like sitting on my futon alone tonite. I'll give a review tomorrow. - I too will be in Jersey for Thanksgiving (probably Wednesday nite til Saturday morning). Give my cellphone or parents' house a ring if any of you would like to get together. Smell ya later... ::End Transmission::

Hello to everyone in the merry land of bloggers! New Jersey is being hit with some brutal weather today, or at least it's being predicted. The wind is ridiculous. As I was walking to my class this morning, my glasses almost flew off of my face. That would have looked pretty funny if it happened. hehe. Anyway, it was like being in Oz. All I was missing was Toto and some sidekicks missing various body parts. As I was taking my accounting test, the windows were shaking and several people got up in the middle of the test to sit away from the windows. Crazy huh? I hear the winds are only supposed to get stronger and we might get some rain. Hopefully, the winds will knock down all power lines on campus so I won't have to go to my night class. Gee, can you tell I'm with Rob in my "I hate school" attitude? Since we're on the topic of school, I am considering ditching the idea of a business degree and sticking with my math major. I think that I could have more job possiblilties with a math major. As Brian told me, "Business is boring." I think he may be right. Working for the NSA or NASA would be much more interesting. I have also considered applying to Stevens again, but I don't think it would be possible for me to go there for several reasons: 1) the commute would suck, 2) I need to work a lot to pay bills, 3) living on campus would be nice but it's expensive (as if the tuition wasn't enough to scare you), 4) i would have to quit my current job(where I have job security and decent pay) and find a new one closer to campus. As much as I would love to go to Stevens, I don't think it would be the best thing for me to do at this point. Maybe if I win the lottery I can go. Besides, they require you to take 6 gym classes. I've been bitching about taking one gym class at Montclair! I couldn't imagine taking 6. Peace out fellow bloggers!

Quincy Carter is shit, and yes, their defense is good, but the Pats seem to be playing with a mission in mind. But I have heard many positive things about their new stuff, so I'm glad you're enjoying it. I haven't heard much new music, I guess because I listen to Q104. urlLink I still love the teen girl squad. Hi Folks I haven't blogged in quite some time. I decided to get you up to date on important things. Lets see... I still have a poster of Gigli up on my wall. I don't think its quite as funny anymore. In fact, I'm weirding myself out now. My project has gone nowhere in about a month due to my not doing much with it. I am off tommorrow and intend to spend the day there. I pretty much hate my school, so my aversion to being there is my main obstacle to tackle. However, I can spend all day tommorrow there. I'm thinking about looking into working at the patent office or something. I get to use my science and engineering background, but not have to work in a lab. I'll look into it. I think the third Matrix movie probably sucks ass, but I won't see it since I thought the first was ok at best and the second blew. I did catch Elf sorta randomly and thought it has some funny parts for sure. Overall, thumbs up for a Christmas movie. I haven't left my house for days due to the overbearing fear of being permeated my immense amounts of christmas music. Does not that assault on our ears start soon? Ok, maybe later. I was joking about not leaving the house though. Or was I? Yes, I was. I like the new Strokes CD. It reminds me of the Cars vaguely with the almost keyboard-guitars and sort of backbeat on some of the songs. I was kinda afraid it would blow, but I think lyrically its still pretty solid. Musically, its similar to the first obviously, but there is enough variety to suit me in the song to song variations. In particular, I enjoy 'Under Control' for its smoothness, 'What ever Happened?' and 'Reptilia' for weird chord progressions on the chorus ( I think thats what I'm describing. ), 'I can't win' overall, and '12:51' since it mentions 40's. Bri, What do you think of Mr. Johnson's bold prediction? I hear various media pundits saying how it was such a bad thing and that it will motivate the Chiefs, but I don't think that will necessarily be the case. I think the Orange and Black need to stay fired up and bold, at least I hope so. Seriously, the Chiefs can't be the best team in football anyway, can they? Maybe they are, but I don't trust their defense yet. We'll see in the playoffs. Anyway, my Pats look good through their bye. This week the Tuna will come back and people will make another big deal out of it. Its been long enough that there are hardly any players left here from his tenure (Law, atta-boy Troy, Bruschi, McGinest, Johnson) and none of them are exactly preoccupied with their first years in the league. Two over-acheiving teams playing on Sunday night should be entertaining even if the media plays up the same boring angles all over again. (Belichick-Parcells; Parcells-Kraft; Glenn sucking for everyone but Parcells; Parcells' daughter being married to Scott Pioli, the Pats co-GM essentially;and Parcells being God) I think they should play up Eugene Wilson playing solid as a rookie at a position never played before this year, or Dat Nguyen being great all of a sudden, or the fact that Quincy Carter still isn't very great. Anyhow, I'll watch it on Sunday night. My predition: Pats 28- 'Boys 20. As for the Kansas Cityans, Cincy 28- Chefs 20. I'll be in NJ for Thanksgiving. If anyone is around, I'd like to get together with anyone, except that dirty dirty Sparta and his perverse ways. Ok, maybe even Sparta. Bloggedy Blog Blog.
Just a p.s., I didn't know Kim already blogged about the weather. Didn't mean to be redundant and sound like an elderly person.

College sucks! I've been having doubts lately about school. I'm at a point where i just don't care anymore. I don't know if it's because i get up really early for classes and I'm just too damn tired to care or if I am truly fed up with my institution of higher learning. Oh well. I'll just have to deal with it, right? In other news, it's cold in NJ again! It was 70 degrees last week and then 3 days later - BOOM -back down to 40 degrees. The trend of everyone getting sick is slowly returning and the germs will soon be traveling through the vents at work. It kinda reminds of that movie Outbreak, but there's no monkey. Brian said he's going to take me and my mom to Red Lobster next week. What a guy! I can't wait to eat lots of shrimp and those delectable cheddar bay biscuits. Adios fellow bloggers!

Because I didn't mention it when I posted the other night...Tom Brady is one sick QB. If there was a way to bet on the Pats when down in the 4th quarter, I would do it hands down. Tomorrow is my day off. Woo! I feel like an elderly person on Wednesday nights because I'm always fatigued and my back hurts. I'll explain why my back hurts, so if you don't want to know then skip to the next paragraph. My boss climbs a large ladder to reach the stock of Christmas candy that we are putting out for sale. He proceeds to drop/throw these boxes full of candy from 2 stories up into my paws. No you may think,"God you pussy, it's only candy." Here's my argument: the boxes of candy contain twenty-four 10 oz bags(24 x 10=240 oz; 240/16=15 pounds). It's like catching a bowling ball over and over again. So my upper back is strained a bit, despite using my legs to support the weight like you're supposed to... As per the recommendation of Dennis and Rob, I am currently reading The Corrections . I'm going at snail's pace, because I only read it when I'm doing my traction at night(that's the technical term for hanging my head and neck in a sling to correct my horrible posture and keep my spine from becoming igor the hunchback). It's quite humorous, but not in a funny ha-ha way, rather a funny intellectual way. I am enjoying it so far, but I have much to go. I'm on page 70, so have about 500 more pages to go. As for Kevin's comment, I thought otherwise of your hand grenade comment at first, but then realized you were talking about New Orleans. Duh! How about those Rangers, though? Huh? [nudge] Huh? They are actually enjoyable to watch again, Kev! As for other news, I miss Matt's presence around here. I hope he's spreading his healing touch to the folks down south...You know what I haven't had in a long time? Big League Chew. If that makes no sense to you, then just let it go... I'll blog to all of you blogs tomorrow. Have a good blog. Blog out, yo.
Dennis - Skip the Hurricane and go straight for the Hand Grenade. Damn, I really need to get back to the French Quarter...

Hello all, Halloween was great down here. They close off UNC and everybody is out in costume. There was 75,000 people here this year. First we went to my friend Garret's house where we had a cool Halloween party. He has a bunch a DJ equipment. Yours truly was spinning Outkast followed by Radiohead and other cool tunes. After that, we went downtown with the masses. All in all pretty cool. This Wenesday, a bunch of us are going to see Matrix Revolutions on the IMAX. I know most of you think Reloaded was crap, but on 2nd viewing, it wasn't as bad as I once thought. If anyone has looked at the college basketball polls, UNC is ranked #10 with 1 first place vote. Should be a pretty good year after our football disaster. The Strokes new album is pretty good. Definetly an indie vibe even though there are on a major label Only 4 days till New Orleans!!! Hurricanes (the drink), voodoo, and the Hornets all in one city!!! Talk to everyone later after my trip to the Big Easy!!!

Weekend over. Well, almost. Monday begins the first full week of November, and insists it will be a warm, mid-70s day. I will spend this day working until 11 pm. My my how this weekend flew by. Friday nite's party at Liz 's house was a nice way to begin the weekend. Saturday's late football start allowed me to get an extra hour of sleep before working on a very pleasant day, and Sunday allowed some quality time with Kim . I'm applying for a teacher assistant position in Rutherford, which is full time and offers benefits. If all goes well, then I will probably jump ship from my current position. I will feel bad for doing such a thing, because Kim's mom was kind enough to get me into a working environment after months of unemployment. However, Liz told me I have to do what's best for me, and that makes sense, and believe it or not, it's not something I hear often. I will probably go more into this topic if I hear about this position, but for right now, I'm gonna shut up and try not to jinx myself. I searched for a couple hours online for teaching postitions and found a few more long-term sub positions that start in January, so there are still some possibilities. I thought I'd given up hope on teaching, but I'm finally seeing some ads. Hopefully, I will get some responses from this batch. In sports-Bengals lost an important game, but I had a bad feeling because they were the favorites and were due for a letdown. The Sixers probably need Big Dogg because their offense is horrible-scratch that-Aaron McKie is horrible. I used to love the guy, but he's not the same player he was when they made it to the finals a few years ago. I'm getting tired. Keep your fingers crossed for this teaching thing.

Ok, I'm back. After our disastrous trip to SC this past summer, Kim and I decided not to go on vacation this year because of our lack of funds. However, we also realized that we would be working our tails off in school this coming semester and working. Yeah, we won't have a ton of money, but as we get older, we still won't have a lot of money to go away with, because we'll take on more responsibilities as we earn more money. My brother had said this to me as well. If we don't go and just say frig it, then we'll never go. Yeah, we may not be swimming in our coin like Scrooge McDuck, but if we can't have fun when we're young, then when will we? So we have a bunch of ideas brewing, but do understand we can't go overboard. Sure we'd love to go to Italy or Hawaii, but in reality, that's a bit too much. We could probably do Arizona or possibly even Florida, depending on the Disney packages available. Heck, we briefly discussed going to the shore, but we'd end up spending just as much down there as we would elsewhere, and it's already been done. I did some preliminary research on flights, and found Phoenix to be not so affordable at $350 round trip, and Orlando at $225 round trip. Disney packages are quite snooty, but I ordered info so I can decide which aspects we can do without. I don't mind either trip, but we would probably go in May, so we could avoid the dead of summer in both instances and not die in the desert or the Magic Kingdom. More details to come as they come to me.

With one meaningless game in progress, the NFL playoff brackets are official. I looked back on my preseason predictions and strengthened my beliefs in my not betting on sports. Here's what I got right... Surprise team: Seattle(had them finishing second behind St. Louis, but missing playoffs) AFC Playoff teams: NE, Tenn, KC NFC Playoff teams: GB, Philly, St. Louis AFC Champ: Tenn over NE Super Bowl: Tenn vs. Philly OK, so I didn't do very well, but that's fine. I said I was going to tell you my grades so here goes (NOTE: if you don't care, don't read the next few lines): Religions of the World: A- Italian I: A- Accounting I: A Business Law: A Business Calculus:A, BOOYAH Mr. Advisor who said I was dumb!!!
