So much to cover on today's version of the blog. Let's start with the past first. This weekend was a pretty enjoyable one. No work, ate good, and had fun. Saturday involved me, Kim, Liz, and Kim's mom going to Red Lobster to celebrate the birthday of Kim's mom(which is actually today). Planned time to depart was 1pm. Skepticism arose on my part because it was a Saturday, and the last Saturday before Christmas, and Red Lobster is on Route 46, just before the mall. I feared sitting in a parking lot of traffic and waiting for hours to get a table. Surprise, surprise! Not much in terms of traffic, and when we got there, it was pretty empty. We ate some dirty seafood and dessert and left for home around 3. We dropped of Kim's mom and then took Liz home because we had to prepare for day 2 of the weekend. P.S.-Sorry I missed your call Den, but as you can see I wasn't really home. I don't believe the game went to 3 OTs...Anyway, I needed some warm, wool socks, which I'll explain in a minute why. Consensus said to go to Kmart. We went and they didn't have any wool socks, so I just got a pack of worker's socks with extra padding. We return to Kim's place so she can pack up some stuff and back to my house so I can get my previously packed things and we're off to Point Pleasant. (Tomorrow we are going to the Eagles-49ers game at the Linc.) We arrive at about 6:30 and talk for a bit before going to eat. Dinner was so-so, and we went to the video store to get a movie since it was still early. As usual, there was nothing good available, so we rented The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen , because Rachel had said she wanted to see it, and because there was nothing else. The movie was pretty horrible. Not much sense was made of it by me or anyone else in the room, but at least it made us tired. Sleep. We woke up on Sunday morning and got ready for the game. Forecast was upper 30s, so we dressed in many layers. It took about an hour and 15 minutes to get there, and it was early still. We ate our sandwiches and walked around the stadium, which is really nice. As we were walking, we noticed all the tvs had the Bengals-Rams game on, because I was the only one in the stadium wearing a Bengals coat and they knew I was cool. Actually, the game was important to the Eagles because it represents home-field advantage throughout the playoffs. Bengals are down 17-10. We see bits as we walk from tv to tv. Kitna has no time at all. Rams drive and kick a FG, up 20-10. More walking, Bengals get ball back and start running. Nice drive going. Roughing the passer on the Rams, move the ball. Tony Stewart with a nice reception. Ball down to the 2. Bengals try corner route to Kelley Washington. Intercepted in the endzone. Old Kitna must have tied up the new Kitna in the locker room. That pass was terrible. Behind the receiver. Ugh. Rams know this is the end. They drive right up field and score a TD. 27-10. 4th quarter, at St. Louis. Game over. Shit. Kev and I grab some hot chocolate for the 4 of us and I grab 2 "hot" pretzels for me & Kim. They were hot when I got them, but were cold by the time we got to the seats. Pre-game lineups are pretty nice. After every 49er's name is announced, the crowd collectively adds "sucks" to the name. (i.e.-"at cornerback, #31, Mike Rumph"..."sucks" "safety, #33 Tony Parish"..."sucks") Funny. Game starts with a deaf child singing the National Anthem(?). Is that possible? So that's what it seemed. Pretty incredible. 49ers lose toss. Eagles receive. First play, McNabb looks down field and is picked off. Wow, not the best way to start a game. 49ers drive, but the holder muffs the snap on a FG attempt. Game remains 0-0. I won't continue with the drive-by-drive coverage because it's boring. Just know that Kevan Barlow could not be stopped and Brian Westbrook is awesome(returned a punt for a TD). 49ers scored a go-ahead TD with 1:58 remaining. Eagles drive and Todd Pinkston makes a nice catch in the endzone. Extra point good. 28-28. On the kickoff, 49ers get caught at their own 10. Eagles hold them on runs and stop clock, but with :01 left, the 49ers call timeout. It's 4th down, and Garcia takes a knee. End of regulation. OT toss-49ers lose and Eagles get kickoff. Crowd erupts. Decent return. First play of OT-McNabb intercepted. A collective "Fuck" arises from our section. Game over. Niners kick a field goal to win 31-28 in OT. Past is covered. Now for the future...The 26th would be a nice night to get together. I have to work until 5, but anytime after that would be fine. If anyone has any fancy ideas, feel free to share, otherwise, we'll spend the night deciding where to go. Hope to see everyone. And in case I don't talk to you beforehand, enjoy Christmas! I registered for my classes today. I have class on Monday and Tuesday nights from 5:30-8. I don't know what to do about work. I'll be working Wed-Fri 9-5, but I would like to have off either Monday or Tuesday, and I don't want to work Sundays. I have to figure it out so I can get 32 hours to keep benefits and stuff.

Horse. Hi people. It's good to hear all the holiday news from everyone. I will be in NJ from Monday to Sunday (22-28). I agree that we should get together indeed. Umm.... I'll talk to you all in person. I gotta go. -BLOG OUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Hello again, I'm heading home Wednesday afternoon/evening and it can't come soon enough in my opinion. Work has been going well, but I got my first bit of criticism today and of course, it has been irritating me more than it should. I was told that my patient treatments are excellent, but I need to improve my ability to manage a full case load. Never mind the fact that my supervisor has been taking all sorts of days off, and somehow, the patients all seem to get treated. Anyway, enough of that. I would really like to get together with everyone. I'll be in NJ from Wednesday until Saturday, so feel free to give me a call at home, email me, or use this truly convenient blog and let me know what works for everyone else. Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all.

Well, Wednesday was my last day of work for the rest of the year. My company gives all employees the week between Xmas and New Years off, plus I had 5 vacation days that I didnt use. So, I am on vacation starting today, Dec. 18th, and I dont go back to work until Jan. 2nd. I am coming back to Jersey for Xmas, but I dont know how long I am staying. The best nite for me to go out with you all would be the 26th. But, my plans can change, depending on everyone else's availability. Have a bloggy Xmas if I dont talk to any of you before then...

Hello all... Today is my last day of finals and I'm stoked. No more waking up at the ass crack of dawn. No more studying. No more dumb jocks and frat boys. A whole month of freedom. Scratch that last one. I'm working full time at the bank during the bank which isn't so bad because I get to make some extra cash. Hopefully the extra cash will help me pay off my credit spending from this lovely Christmas season. Anyways, I saw 2 of my grades for this semester and they were good, but I plan on revealing my grades to you all in one shot. I doubt anyone would enjoy a day by day reveal of my grades. Does anyone care about my grades anyway? You doods better be coming home for Christmas! We should go back to the Town Pub to get some grog and make fun of people because we really didn't do much of that last time. Gonna go do some last minute studying. See ya!! P.S.- In the little mini-mart on campus, I saw a box Big League Chew.

Greetings and salutations. I realize Christmas is a mere 8 days away, and still don't know if I have to work on Christmas day or not. I guess I will be a little bummed, but I don't think it will be all that bad, as long as I'm not working all day. I'm also still waiting for an "official" letter from urlLink Montclair State about my acceptance. The semester starts in a month, so I hope to get things done asap...Yesterday at work, I had a Clerks moment. Some old lady asked me where a certain candy was, and like the smart-ass I can be when it's 5 minutes before I leave, I say "probably over by the rest of the candy." Then I left. Oh well. Kim and I are going to the urlLink Eagles -49ers game on Sunday with the brother and sister-in-law. I haven't been to a pro football game in quite some time. I think I went with my brother a few years ago to an Eagle game, but I'm not sure. Otherwise, it was many years ago when Boomer was on his last stint with the Bengals at the Vet. My brother's been hooking me up with some sports festivities lately. I like it a lot. Maybe next I'll be able to see Monster's Inc on Ice or something. Hooray for Mike doing a triple axle. I have a plan for the future. When I talked to the comm professor at Montclair, he said NJ doesn't really have a good school to pursue my doctorate in comm. I've always wanted to go west(i.e. Arizona or even Nevada), so I may just move out there while finishing my education just to get away for a while. I did a little research, and found that Arizona State has a vast variety of programs that suit my interests. I intend on looking for UNLV, Nevada, and Arizona as well. I think it will be an awesome experience, plus I won't be breathing in pollution as much as I am here. The only thing would be that moving out there would require me to have a place to live. Lots more research to come... Is anyone coming back to NJ for the holidays? Kindly share your ideas. Sorry I don't AIM anymore. I'm not home during the day, and usually do stuff at nite. This blog is already staying past its welcome. Good day!

Hey Bri, your Christmas wish of no snow until February has been flushed down the toilet... Once again, we are snowed in here in NJ and it is no fun. I was supposed to get breakfast and go Christmas shopping with my mom today, but I dont think I want to drive in this weather. Me and Brian were watching the weather channel last night and they something about the wind gusts being so high that they might actually turn your car over if you drive over bridges and all that good stuff. So I think it would be best for me to keep my ass in the house. Besides today is the perfect opportunity for me to get some studying done for my finals. Then again, it would also be a good day to catch up on some sleep. I shall contribute to the holiday spirit by posting my own Christmas wish list: *I also want Rachel's mom to be 100% better. It is a shame that such a sweet woman has to go through all the crap she does. *$10,000. That's all I need to pay off my car and other miscellaneous debt. *an Aston Martin Vanquish sitting next to Brian's Jeep in our imaginary driveway in our imaginary house in Arizona *Since, I intend to move where it never snows, I wish to never go anywhere snows. **Exception, I would love to go on a cruise to Alaska. *A very large collection of my favorite sneaker - Pumas. I already have 4 pairs. However, I think 10 more pairs, all in various colors, should do the trick. *I also need a CD collection overhaul, but in my case I just need more different CD's. *A trip to Italy. I'm learning to speak Italian now and I'm fascinated with the language. I would love to mingle with the Italians and eat lots of pasta and pizza. *Ted Alexandro and Brian Regan DVD's. Two very funny doods. Everyone should catch one of their shows. *A teaching job for Brian. *For all of friends and family to be happy. That is my list. Now get to work!!! Just kidding!

With the holidays approaching rapidly, I figured I needed to bring some Christmas spirit to this blog. So I'm gonna post my Christmas list. Here's what I want for Christmas: *Rachel's mom to be fully cured for good. No more worries. These are the things that would be nice as a bonus, but don't come close in comparison to priority #1: *a Bengals playoff berth *a new Jeep sitting in my imaginary driveway in my imaginary house in Arizona *stop hearing about Paris Hilton *no more snow until maybe February *an overhaul of my music collection(I have too many cds I don't ever listen to) *to pay off my credit card(actually I'm almost there) *Alias Season 2 DVD *a winter coat *spend time with Kim, my family, and friends, and not have to worry about crap for the time that I'm with them. So that's it. Feel free to share your lists amigos.

Forgive me father, for I have sinned. It's been six days since my last blog. So friggin' sue me. Not too much has occurred in my life this stretch of a hiatus from the blog. The weekend was rather uneventful because I was snowed in on Saturday. Sunday, I was able to see Kim at least, and escape my house for a few hours. I couldn't tell you what I did on Monday other than work since I can't remember. Tuesday I saw Kim again and we watched the previously mentioned Alias . Last night I went to see the urlLink Rangers game with my brother. Enter new paragraph. Despite being a fan for my life, I had never been to the garden for a Ranger game. Sad, I know. Anyway, my brother, who is the best brother in the universe, got tickets from a co-worker to see them against Montreal. My brother had to work last night, as did I. I worked until 5, and his last report was at 6:45. The game started at 7. The positive was that he works in Rutherford, and I in Carlstadt. The drive was not taxing to say the least. He decided it would be best if we drove into the city since we were close to route 3, and we figured if we took the PATH, we'd probably get there even later. His friend gave him a shortcut thru Hoboken to bypass the winding road leading to the tunnel, which probably knocked a good 15 minutes off our wait, but we still had to go thru the tunnel. The tunnel was a very slow crawl. We ended up missing the entire first period, with the Canadiens leading 1-0, but listening on the radio en route to the arena. When we got into Manhattan, there was surprisingly a crapload of traffic and stupid people crossing on red lights, etc. We parked not far away, and walked to the garden. (Side note: the only Rangers jersey I have is an old one of Niklas Sundstrom. Ironically, he's on the Canadiens now) Upon entering, we walk towards tower "D" which is the gate listed on our tickets. Then some guy tells us everyone has to enter thru tower "B." Unfortunately, we circumnavigate the arena, passing long-ass lines at the snacky stands before arriving at our section, 72. Usher guy tells us to go around to the other side to our seats, and when we do, we find people sitting in them. We proceed back to where we first came in and ignore the usher and sit in close by but empty seats. We sit down and Chris Simon and Darren Langdon begin beating the bloody hell out of each other. Nice way to start the second period. A few minutes later, people show up who have tix for the seats we're in. We go back to our real seats and make the people there move. Now we're stuck in the middle of the row. Neither of us had eaten dinner and we don't feel like going thru ten people to get to the stairs or waiting in line for food. Chris Simon scores the tying goal in the second, and the Rangers fall apart in the third to lose 2-1. After the game, we drive back into Weehawken and hit up Houlihan's for some post-game dinner. Good nachos and a chicken sandwich do me well, and then it's off to pick up my car and drive home. End night. I really had an awesome time. The atmosphere at the garden is filled with energy. It gave me hope that I can get to more games from now on. May blog this weekend. If not, enjoy the snow on Sunday again. Godammit!

Finals are here and I haven't really done any studying. Studying isn't my bag baby yeah. Sorry. Bad Austin Powers reference. I have a religion final on thursday, business law on friday, italian on tuesday, and accounting and calc on thursday. The only class I am studying for is Italian. So my week shouldn't be so stressful. However, I had/have to wake up at 5:30 to go to class tuesday thru friday. It's a good thing I'm not working saturday. Maybe I can get some decent sleep then. I still haven't done any Christmas shopping. I only picked up 2 things so far and one of them is on backorder. I hope it gets here before Christmas. In other news, I am now addicted to Alias. I never really wanted to watch the show because I didn't see what was so great about Jennifer Garner. Ok she's pretty, I'll give her that, but she's not to die for gorgeous. Anyway, Brian bought the first season on dvd and we can't stop watching it and now we're tuning in to watch the new episodes on sunday night. I can't wait to see the second season and the beginning of the third season. Damn you Brian for getting me addicted to Alias!!!
Guess what's more boring than Connecticut? ****************************************** Connecticut buried in a crap load of snow...

Pizza nite! And a blizzard ensues. This crazy weather. It's probably snowed about 5 or 6 inches I'll say, and it's supposed to continue through tomorrow night. The good thing about it was that I went to work early with Kim's mom, and was able to leave early, at 3:30. It had started to accumulate, but not as bad as if I left my normal time(5 or 5:30). I woke up this morning at 6, because I had to go in early, and turned on the tv. I noticed that route 3 was shut down at Passaic Avenue, just the place I had to drive to. So I find out that someone was speeding at 3 am and hit a utility pole. The road was closed until about 9 I think. Traffic was diverted thru Clifton and Nutley for 6 hours. That's a pretty poor job considering it's a major highway leading to the city. Anyway, that's the story of the morning. Since my next two days are shot, I'm probably gonna shovel tonite and clean my room. I helped my dad put up Christmas lights tonight already, but it's still only 8! Man I'm bored. I'm chatting with Kim and Liz right now, so I'm gonna go. Enjoy the snow.
Awesome! I'm very very happy to hear both sets of good news. Congratulations all around.

If you already read Kim's blog from earlier today, or if you happen to read the blog backwards, then you know I have good news. I met with the professor from urlLink Montclair State , and he told me he's going to have the school write me an official letter of acceptance into grad school! Dude, I can't even tell you how happy I am after hearing that. He was really nice and helpful. He explained the three paths in communication I can take, and recommended the first two classes to take. He also said that I may have a good chance of gaining a teaching assistantship since I have some teaching background, and a communication background. I am so psyched. So that's the good news of the day. My appointment was at 12:30, and I was done by 1, so I decided to do some Christmas shopping since I took the day off from work. I finished shopping for Kim, mom, dad, my brother, my uncle and his girlfriend. All that in an hour and 15 minutes. I got to the mall at 1:30 and left at 2:45. I beat traffic home as well. It was a pretty sweet few hours. Unfortunately, it's back to work tomorrow in a blizzard, or so I hear. I'm not ready for snow yet. If it's going to be a big storm, then this is one of the earliest big snowfalls I can remember. Usually they hit in Feb or March. Anyway, that's winter for you. I think if I feel adventurous, I may tinker with my urlLink webpage today. Kim's at school, and I don't have anything else to do.

I had an appointment today with the chair of the math department and she was very nice. We talked about what jobs I can do with a math degree and she helped me compare the business and finance majors. She told me that a lot of jobs dont require math majors but they love the way math nerds think. People employ math majors for their problem solving abilities, not necesarily the degree. As far as the incident with my advisor is concerned, she said it came to her as a shock that he would say such a thing. She said she talked to him about it and he supposedly feels bad that he upset me. At this point I don't really care. If he feels bad, fine. If he doesn't, oh well. To me it's over and there's no reason for me to dwell on a negative comment from someone who doesn't even know me. She actually offred to arrange for me to take the calculus readiness test which my advisor never even told me existed. I told her I would think about it but that I was ok with taking the precalculus class anyway. All in all, it was a good meeting. I walked away happy and relieved. Anyhoo, we're supposed to be getting some sort of snow storm and I'm not looking forward to it at all. I don't mind snow when it's in small amounts and it makes everything look pretty. But, when there's more than 3 inches of snow on the ground, I hate it! Snow is the inconvenience of all inconveniences. Gotta finish up some homework before heading back to class. Peace out homeboys! P.S. Brian has some good news he might share with us later.

Welcome, December. Man am I happy this year is almost over. Hopefully it will mean I am thisclose to beginning grad school and even closer to leaving job x. It's Monday, and that means the late shift at my crappy job. Gotta be there at 2:30, so I still have some time. I haven't mentioned this on here yet, mainly because I don't know what to do about it-my sister in law's father found a job for me. It's in a private school in Brick as a computer teacher, which will allow me to work 3-4 days a week, with the option to pay into benefits. The job is mine if I want it, since they really need someone. My brother and sister-in-law have made their home available to me the days I would work there, so that's great and I wouldn't have to commute over an hour every morning. Obviously I also want to start grad school, and I don't know the final decision because I have to interview hopefully this week at the school. Anyway, I wanted to find out the decision before making a decision about the job, because it would be difficult to do both, unless I knew my schedule for work and classes. I mention the job yesterday to one of my family members, who later in the day tells another family member, and the latter family member decides to attack me and basically question why I would even consider the job. That really pissed me off because it has nothing to do with this person. It's my choice to make for something I need to do-work in my field. I still haven't made up my mind about it and say this, but I'm still questioned because it "doesn't make sense." I guess I know why I wonder about my confidence so much. People shoot down my outlooks by overemphasizing the negatives and not even seeing the positives for me. Anyway, fuck that shit. Bengals won another awesome game yesterday, shoving it right up Pittburgh's ass. Next week is the battle for the AFC North. On a related note, Kim asked me if I thought the Bengals could get to the Super Bowl yesterday. After initially smiling, I realized that lately in sports, anything is possible. Remember the year the Pats won the SB, Rob? Who was in the SB last year? Oh right, they're both awful this year? Cuse won the NCAA, the Marlins won the series, the Spurs won the NBA. Stranger things have happened, but I'm not going to get ahead of myself. If they made the playoffs, that would be simply amazing in itself.

It's time once again for my random blog. I'm still in Middle of Nowhere, Georgia and it's going pretty well. I switched over to an Outpatient Clinic and so far, so good. It's interesting to see such a wide variety of patients (pretty much all ages and various conditions), but it's also been tough just coming from a setting where I would see one type of patient all the time. It may take some time for my brain to adjust. Anywho, I'm glad to hear that Brian's accident has not left any residual physical damage, although it does pain me to hear he went to a chiropractor. In other random news, I was happy to see Bill Murray take the Golden Globe and get an Oscar nomination, but Johnny Depp was nominated in the same category for Pirates of the Carribean, what the hell?! I guess Disney paid some people off. I'm off to Florida this weekend to see dear ol' Dad. He had some surgery a couple weeks ago, but has come through like a champ. Enjoy the game on Sunday, even if CBS did ban that great anti-Bush commercial. Back into the shadows of Warm Springs I go, Matt

I decided to play hooky. I woke up at 7 because I was supposed to be at work for 8:30. I looked out the window and saw that the snow wasn't what I expected. I turned on the tele to find we've received somewhere between 7 and 10 inches of snow. I saw school closings scroll across the screen and noted colleges were closed, as were several government buildings. I decided that I wasn't going in. I wasn't going to risk driving in icy conditions to a job where I make next to nothing, especially since I was just in an accident. So my morning consisted of digging out 3 cars from mounds of snow, some soft, and some quite heavy due to the plows kicking it all up against the sides of the vehicles. I came in and ate some Fruity Pebbles and watched some Sportscenter. I decided to play with my urlLink website , and updated my urlLink photos section by adding some links with the pics. There are also some new shows listed for the NY/NJ area. No major format changes due to the fact that I can't find the installation disk for my scanner, so it just sits there and never gets any action. I just got my mail and received my much anticipated urlLink No Motiv cd. Daylight Breaking is a damn good cd. It's a bit heavier than their last album, but the ep that came out a few months ago didn't let me down in terms of holding me over until this came out. They also had a song that was featured in the X-games, which just ended, and they played out there at the games, too. I'll probably be back outside shoveling a bit more before doing more homework today. Class was cancelled last night, but that didn't prevent him from piling on 6 more journals to read for next tuesday. I haven't looked at all of them, but the last one is 35 pages alone. Bloody hell.

First off, I want to thank Rob for calling me. I got your message, but will try to call you tomorrow during the day when I am not half asleep and while I'm home. Secondly, I will also try to call Den, since I owe him a call from about 2 weeks ago. And fyi, I am doing ok in terms of recovery from the accident. My only ailments now are going to be my funds due to having to purchase a new vehicle and increasing auto insurance. I'm still on a 3x a week schedule at the good ol' chiropractor to heal my whiplash and soreness in my neck. Other than that, I think everything is ok, and hopefully will stay that way... I had my first meeting of my other class tonite. Borrrrrrrrrrrrring. We had a 4 minute break, but he kept us for 5 minutes after the scheduled meeting time. He seems like a nice guy, but he lectured at us the entire night. No interaction as far as discussions go. There are only 5 people in the class too. We don't meet next week because he's going to Michigan to apply for a position over there. So I guess I won't be working with him next semester. In other news, I'm unwillingly embracing the next storm heading our way. The only reason being that I don't want to drive my dad's car in the snow/ice to school for one class. It's not worth it, especially since my driving wreck a week ago...My job is fucking horrible. My boss is annoying and the customers are obviously annoying, but the routine is unbearable. I graduated school with a degree in communication and certification to teach grades K-8. The only thing remotely concerned with either of those is talking at work. I don't listen to most of my coworkers because they are ignorant(except for a few, one being Kim's mother, of course.) What made it worse was that last Tuesday, I talked with the 7 other people in my class, and they all have at least a decent job, and it has something to do with comm. The only thing I have applied for is a job with the nba, but I have no PR experience, so the odds of me actually being hired are slim. I'm gonna see if my classmates can get me an in or something or give me advice. Due to the whole accident, our vacation plans are probably nixed. I need to buy a new vehicle, and I mean new, because I don't want a car that will simply hold me over to my next one. I'm just going to invest in something I like and work simply to pay for it and insurance. I'm aiming for a Jeep Wrangler, and hope to bring one home within the next two weeks.

It's been a while since I've blogged so I figured I should check in... Nothing new has been going on. Classes started again :( but thats ok because I was tired of being at the bank all the time... I bought a new car!!! That's right folks. I traded in my prized 98 Altima for a brand spanking new Nissan Sentra. I test drove the SE-R which is the super sporty model but it didn't have ABS so I said "Funk Dat! Give me ABS biznatch!" I really didn't say that, but I got my ABS along with power locks, power windows, keyless entry, power sunroof, and killer speakers to play my music even louder that I already do. Me so happy!!! I also got cheaper insurance which is awesome. I was paying 4G's a year for the other car and now I'm saving $2500 with a new company. Can you believe that?!? I got a brand new car and my insurance cut in half. Although I love my new car I felt really bad about getting it since Brian got into the accident and totalled his car just 2 days before I went to the dealer. However, I'm glad he's not driving because I get to show off my car. Just kidding. I am looking forward to Brian's list of exciting dates. Especially.... you guessed it... HEY MERCEDES!!!! Actually I'm more excited about the comedy shows. Anyhoo, I hope everyone is doing well. Peace out yo!!

This entry may take a long time for two reasons: 1)there's a lot of useless information & 2)I have a horrible stomach ache, which I've had pretty much all nite. Anyway, if anyone may remember, I created a team in NFL 2004 called the NJ Vandals. There was this whole expansion draft where I drafted crappy players, etc. Anyway, I finally finished my season and did it in a good way. I won the friggin' super bowl! You probably don't care, but I have always been a fan of good video games, and this game in particular was actually enjoyable, even though I almost lost a few times. Anyway, I'm going to give you the summary of the big game and some stats because I've always been a stat person(hey, it's one of my jobs). Philly(13-3) vs. NJ(9-7) in the Super Bowl. 1st Quarter-I win toss and receive ball. I get a couple of nice runs and pass plays going and dig into Philly territory. My QB(Jeff Blake) throws an int at the 20. Oh no! Bad way to swing momentum. Eagles get ball and drive right downfield, capped off by a Duce Staley 33 yd TD run(7-0 Phi). 2nd Quarter-I had gotten the ball back after the Eagles drive and began driving before the end of the 1st. I'm running well and passing well again, and find Jake Reed for a 17 yd strike(7-7). Eagles get ball back and go right thru my defense. Thrash with a 4 yd rec(14-7 Phi). I get ball back with 2:00 left. Another good drive with variety and punch it in with a Dee Brown 8 yd run(14-14). 3rd Quarter-Eagles drive again right thru my defense, but I recovered a fumble and controlled much of the clock in the 3rd, before scoring on a Brian Westbrook 1 yd run(21-14 NJ). 4th Quarter-Unfortunately, after scoring in the 3rd, I had to kickoff. Eagles drive thru me again and score with lots of time remaining.(roughly 3 minutes). With the game tied, I try to be conservative at first, but suddenly could not run. I tried to pass and they sacked me. I go for it on 4th because they would probably score on me anyway. Pass dropped. Turnover. Back to Philly. They fumble. I get the ball and can't move again. Eagles get ball on downs and kneel with :02 left in regulation, tied at 21. OT-Eagles win toss and receive. I think it's over. They drive as usual thru my defense and get to about my 35. On 3rd down, they pass, but I pick it off! Woo! I feel the momentum and begin running them down. I punch it in with Westbrook from the 6 and win 27-21 in OT! Damn good game for a video game. Blake 14-28 223 yds 1TD/1INT Dee Brown 11 rush 79 yds TD Lamont Warren 11 rush 68 yds Westbrook 7 rush 26 yds 2TD Freddie Mitchell 7 rec 114 yds Reed 3 rec 52 yds TD Pete Mitchell 3 rec 51 yds So I had an enjoyable experience with an expansion team. Pretty realistic because the players I got were woeful. I traded for a QB early in the season, and created a safety because I needed someone who could tackle one on one. I ended up winning my last 4 games to win my division, the only way I could have made the playoffs. Despite lots of swearing and anxiety, I was glad it was challenging, and surprised I was able to find my defense in the playoffs. Here's some of my final stats: Blake 159-277 2,482 yds 18TD/8INT 96.9 Rating Warren 143 rush 1,014 yds 14TD Westbrook 159 rush 984 yds 13 TD Brown 47 rush 265 yds 7TD F. Mitchell 91 rec 1,430 yds 12TD Reed 33 rec 657 yds 6TD P. Mitchell 33 rec 432 yds 3 TD Houshmandzadeh 20 rec 327 yds Damon Moore 84 tckls 3 INT Lenoy Jones 42 tckls 3 sacks INT Darrien Gordon 36 tckls 3 INT Sorry if you read this, but I forewarned you about the length and subject. Anyway, my stomach still hurts in waves. I'm gonna go to bed soon and hopefully feel better. PS-Kev I tried your link and it didn't work for me. Den I owe you a phone call. Sorry I missed your call the other day.

I know this is a little late, but HAPPY NEW YEAR!! Big deal right? Like most people, I made some new years resolutions and they are as follows: 1. Stay away from red meat. This doesn't mean I'm never going to eat it again, I'm just going to avoid it as best as I can. 2. No fried foods. I was doing pretty good with this last year so let's see if I can keep it up. 3. When I'm mad at someone, I usually take it out on an innocent person. For example, I'm mad at my brother (which happens often) and I take it out on Brian. Is this fair? No, it is not. So I hereby intend to yell at my brother more.. err.. express to people that they piss me off. 4. Exercise more. This is a very popular resolution that many make and, of course, break. I hope to start running again once it gets warmer, but until then I'll do stairmaster. However, I recognize now that I may never do either so I really won't be breaking this resolution. 5. No more road rage. When I drive, I have tourettes (sp?). Therefore, I intend to avoid using my potty mouth when driving. 6. Save more money. This isn't a very easy thing to do, but I want to put some money away every week, even if its only $5. 7. Continue to not eat after 8pm. However, there are exceptions to the rule. If I'm out with friends and they want to eat after the previously mentioned time, it is acceptable as long as its not an everyday thing (which it isn't). 8. Stay away from ice cream, especially my favorite - vanilla with peanut butter syrup. I shall limit my ice cream consumption to once a month. No more and maybe less. I think this is enough. If anyone catches me breaking any of these resolutions, smack me. Please feel free to share your resolutions on this wonderful thing we call a blogger.

Greetings. Today I had a great feeling of accomplishment. Nothing major happened, but last night I made a list of a shitload of things I had to get done today, since I was home during the day before going to class at night. I got all of them done, well, I was supposed to read 4 articles for class tonight. That didn't exactly happen. I skimmed 3 of them very briefly, and one was 20 pages, so I didn't have time to read it, but everything else was completed. I started by getting the registration and license plates for my new car from the dealer. On the way home, I registered my car at Monkey State so I can park there without paying the parking garage. I then proceeded to deposit my two checks from work into the bank and mailed my first car payment. When I got home, I registered for a new ez pass tag, filed my state and federal taxes, filed my renewal fafsa, and finished my paper which was due tonite. I was satisfied. It's been a while since I felt like I accomplished a lot. Anyway, that feeling will subside tomorrow when I realize I have to do a 3 page paper for next Tuesday, along with 4 more readings, read a chapter for my Monday class, and begin my research project for my Monday class as well. But I'll sleep well tonight. My brother's birthday is next week, and as usual, I have no idea what to get him. There's only so many times I can get him an Eagles or Sixers jersey. I guess I can get him a Mike Cameron jersey.(that was sarcasm, since he's a Mets fan, and that's their big free-agent signing I guess). I'm now going to rant a bit...I apologize in advance if you enjoy coffee, but it's something that bothers me to an extent...Why is it that coffee is acceptable to drink in the workplace? In my case, it's severe, and my manager(s) are never seen without a coffee in hand. I don't like the smell or taste of it, and I really am not a fan of folks who always smell like it, either. In addition, I really get peeved at the people who are shocked and put me down when I say I don't like coffee. You don't like coffee? Oh my! Isn't it a case of a mood-altering drug? I know caffeine is not a controlled substance, but it is obviously addictive. People use it as a staple in their diets in order to keep things going during the day. I guess my gripe really lies in the reason that this drink was selected to be the drink that's allowable in the workplace. I don't know, I guess one day I want to go to my awful job and see a big ass jug of Hawaiian Punch sitting in the break room with two workers eating cookies and sipping their cups of the red juice while giving a hateful glare in the direction of the lowly employee with brown teeth brewing a pot of taster's choice.

I got a few things accomplished today. First and most importantly, I received insurance for my automobile. I don't want to pay for it, but I need it unfortunately, and now the car doesn't have to sit at the dealer lot while my insurance is processed! On my way home from Randolph, I conveniently stopped at my old stomping grounds at Willy P. I needed to pick up a copy of my immunization records because Montclair insists on sending me an abundance of emails telling me about my registration hold because of my missing measles booster shot. Now I have the evidence and they can shove it up their ass. This weekend was rather anti-climactic after anticipating a nice one. On Saturday, Kim and I went to a lovely place for dinner, and upon completing the dinner, I realized something wasn't right. I mentioned we should probably leave because I felt an uneasiness in my stomach. As soon as we made the U-turn to come home from Pine Brook, which is up on 46 West, past Fairfield, I came to the conclusion that I might not make it home if I don't find a restroom. So I drive rapidly towards home, only to find(as usual) much traffic by Willowbrook Mall. I now knew I definitely wouldn't make it home. We finally made it to a service station and I ran. I was relieved, but at the same time knew it wasn't over. Luckily we made it back to my house so I could at least be sick the rest of the night in comfort. I've had a few diagnoses from different folks: tainted food, allergic reaction, irritable bowel attack, stomach virus. None of them sound pleasant, but I'm hoping that whatever it was, it's over now. I didn't eat much on Sunday due to my uneasiness, but was feeling ok otherwise. The lovely Kim made me some pasta for dinner, which was good to eat instead of soup. Yesterday I ate safely and was ok, and today I ate breakfast so far, and think I'm ok. Rob, I don't think we can post pictures on the blog since I don't own the site. If I had my own website where the blog was, then it could work, otherwise it cannot...Any input on the Van Horn trade? I was pissed. I thought he was playing well for the Knicks. I'm off to do homework.

I feel empty inside with my dearth of recent blogs. Hence I am posting. However, It's got to be quick. Life has been ok for me lately. I still dislike school, like an 8 year old. (Though I never disliked it when I was 8...) I am going back to work after a week off from the theater. I'm not really looking forward to it, so maybe I'll like school better, motivated by my dislike of work. hehe. The Pats won the Superbowl. Sorry to all you Panthers supporters out there, since they really were a fun team on a few levels. I hope the Pats keep a solid franchise with their new structure which I'm sure this time around will be more scrutinized and copied. I can understand most people not being interested since they're not real flashy (even that is an overstatement). But I find them likable and successful simultaneously. I'm biased and I know it. The celebratons were ok in Boston. Good mood, more subdued since they were favorites. few injuries, one drunk guy ran over somebody. I went to the parade and took a few pictures. I'll try to post one here later if someone will tell me if it's possible. I've been reading a really great book right now as well. It's called 'The Buying of the President 2004'. It's a book by a guy from the urlLink Center for Public Inegrity , one of those non-partisan, non-profit groups. The whole idea is to give actual information about the political candidates, their careers, their backgrounds, and their financial backing as opposed to all the stuff in the media which is watered down, filtered, spun, and selectively chosen. From my reading thus far, it's unbiased toward either party and gives good information on who has funded the parties campaigns, and the expected return for those funds in the form of legislation favors. From what I can see, the whole system of lobbyists and contributions almost directly leads to results in legislation, like money for laws. Anyway, it's saddening but useful to know. So I wanted to know what to actually expect from a candidate in form of action if elected, as opposed to fancy speeches and empty promises. The list of contributors will almost certainly tell what issues wll really be tackled if a guy is the next president. Anyway, I think I'll have a more informed vote. That's my 2 cents for today. Have a good one all.

Howdy. It's been some time since the last blog of mine. Unfortunately, there hasn't been much in terms of daily news. However, I did have the luck of purchasing a new urlLink car on Tuesday. I am extremely happy, as it feels good to finally have a car to call my own, and a new one at that. It's also good because my credit was good, and now it will be even better for my future. It's a four door with automatic transmission. I didn't get any major options or packages besides a/c. The only option I wanted was ABS, but it was only offered on the upper level models, so I decided it wasn't necessary for $4,000. The car is a sand color, has a cd player(with controls for the radio right on the steering wheel!). It is a compact car, but has lots of room in the interior and trunk. It comes standard with front air bags, and has a feature in which the car can only be started with the key because of a chip that only reads the key's code. The only negative, if there is one, is that I am stressing about insurance. The dealer gave me spot insurance, which is good for 14 days. I don't officially have insurance yet, so these quotes are important because I have to officially apply asap, since it takes 7 business days for most insurance policies to process, which would take me to exactly the Tuesday when the spot coverage expires. If the spot coverage expires before my insurance kicks in, then I have to leave the car at the dealer until it takes effect. That would suck. It's not the end of the world, because it would be a couple days max, but it's something I don't want to deal with. So that's my big story of good news. The last month has been pretty miserable for me, so this was a nice lift. Still struggling at school. Excessive reading is taking its toll on me, and I haven't had much of a social life since classes began. Work's the same story: trite and annoying. Routine hasn't changed, and my tiredness from reading carries over into my work, causing extreme crankiness...Valentine's Day is Saturday. Does anyone care? I sure don't. In my final bit of information that you probably don't care about...I haven't been eating breakfast on a normal basis the last 2 weeks, and couldn't figure out why. I always eat breakfast, unless of course I'm sick. Well, I'm not sick, but I think it's because I'm not hungry in the morning. I have class Mon and Tues nite, and eat when I get home, and work late Thurs, and eat when I get home, so I think it's because I eat right before I go to bed. Anyway, maybe I'll start eating breakfast at night.

As Brian and I have discussed recently, Sunday has to be the worse day of the week. Brian says its a bad day because you know you have to go to work the next day and all you can think about is how bad work sucks. I totally agree with him but I have another arguement as to why Sunday sucks - church. It's all well and good that people go to church but being that I live 30 seconds away from a church I hate the traffic that is causes. Church traffic sucks by itself but being that the Clifton Commons, Costco, Target, and Route 3 are also nearby, it makes getting out of my driveway a living hell. I despise trying to go out on Sunday because I know it takes me 20 minutes to get out of my damn driveway. I dragged Bri with me to see the Westfield Symphony Orchestra last nite. My professor is the conductor of the orchestra and he requires us to go to 2 concerts and write reviews for each one. However, this is the only actual work we have to do all semester. That's fair, right? Anyway, as we were going to cross the street to get to the parking lot, some guy in a Lexus truck says to the cop that's stopping traffic for us pedestrians ,"Hey! I've got a dog that has to get to the hospital!" The cop had this bewildered look on his face which I thought was totally priceless. So he tells us not to cross and lets this guy with the sick dog go. As he drove by, I saw a german shepard in the back seat wagging his tail. Now I'm not a dog expert or anything but I think that if a dog is sick he wouldnt be wagging his tail. I thought tail wagging was a sign of happiness. I could be worng. So next time I see a dog wagging his tail, I am to assume he is choking on his milkbone and should get him to a vet immediately. Anyways, the concert was somewhat enjoyable... until we got lost. When we were leaving the parking lot, we went the wrong way and continued to do so for about 30 minutes. Once we finally got on the parkway, I was relieved. However, this relief went away very quickly as we encountered many assholes who love to go 90 mph until they get right on your bumber and then pass you on the right. If anyone has forgotten, you're supposed to pass on the left and the speed limit, contrary to popular belief, is not 90. Actually there was some poopface in a jetta that entered onto the parkway and proceeded to cut across 3 lanes, nearly hitting some guy in a minivan which made that guy swerve into the left lane and almost hit some other guy in the the left lane. The funny thing was the guy in the jetta didnt slow down or stay where he was. He insisted on being where the minivan was. Weird. Then i got behind some drunk guy swerving all over the road and doing 35 mph. Driving in NJ is like that extreme elimination show that I love so much on Spike TV. Yeah so thats my boring blog for today. Hope you enjoyed!

Ahh, glorious Tuesdays. I get to hopefully catch up on my sleep for the week by sleeping in till about 9:30. I then continued doing homework, which is a perpetual event for me. It only goes on hiatus while I'm working, sleeping, and eating. It's now just about noon, so I cannot function intellectually anymore, so this blog may be branded with dozens of swear words due to my lack of vocabulary. Yeah, so homework is killing me. The readings are just overwhelming, and I'm hoping it gets better very soon. I also noticed that I can barely read the notes I took, so I have to remember how to write well enough to comprehend it at a later date. Since I woke up and did homework all morning, I have yet to take a shower or do anything else. Luckily, the only thing on my agenda is my night class at 5:30 tonite. No work today, thank god. I currently have an academic hold at Montclair due to immunizations. Apparently, I never received a second measles vaccination, which makes no sense because William Paterson has the same requirements as Montclair, and I graduated from WP without any word of this missing vaccination. So I have to go up to WP and get my records from the health center to see what the deal is. The only problem is that the only time I can go is Tuesday during the day, and my mom has the car today, and last Tuesday it snowed. I will now go into my Super Bowl retrospective...I hitched a ride with my brother's friend Moose to my brother's house. We arrived at 4 and ate immediately. We had some doritos, veggies and dip, and m&ms to start, then the good food arrived: *4 pound shrimp ring *3 pounds of fried and coconut shrimp *75 wings from hooters *100 hal-dogs *chicken fingers and jalapeno poppers *nachos *Rachel's home-made lasagna *dirt *my jello cake thing *jello football helmets I ate one or more of everything listed, and we played catch with the famous Illuminator football pre-game, and at the half. As for the game itself, well I was bored to tears for the first 35 minutes of gametime. Finally, there was some action before the half to stir some anticipation for the second half, which was outstanding. I have to admit, I was pulling for the Panthers, especially when they actually kept it close, but I knew they weren't going to hold the lead. The night ended on a good note for me as I won $65 for getting the final score in a grid pool. Only $3,435 more needed for a down payment for a car! Hey hey! I'm off to the showers and probably read more before class.

Greetings. Just a short blog to wish Rob and his Pats luck today, although I can't really say I'm rooting for either team, just hoping for a good game. Enjoy the festivities all, and I'll talk to you soon.

I went to class last night feeling even worse than I felt last Monday, but I didn't want to miss 2 in a row. I woke up today with my entire left side of my nose stuffed completely. At least my throat doesn't hurt as much. I think I actually slept pretty well, however, so that's a positive. I've already done some homework this morning, but still have a little more to do. I hope I can get rid of this cold or whatever soon. I found out last night that if I choose not to enroll in classes in the fall, I have until October to start paying back my loans from this semester. That gives me some time over the summer to save up some money hopefully. That reminds me, good luck to Kevin in your MBA classes starting tonite, and good luck to Matt in your exit exam and finding a job! I don't believe you're done already. Wow. If I feel well enough, Kim and I are probably gonna hang out with urlLink Katie and Chris . Then on Sunday, I have to go to my uncle's house for some reason to have pre-Easter dinner. Easter is in 2 weeks. This means 2 Sundays in a row are going to be wasted sitting inside at a relative's house. This is bad for several reasons, but mainly because I have to finish my 20-page paper, and two 10-page papers before the semester ends around May 8th or something. Sunday is one of my days I do a lot of work, but I guess not those two weeks.

I am back in North Carolina and as scared as I am to admit it, it feels pretty good. I suppose anything would be an improvement over Warm Springs. On that note, I submitted my first application to a Rehab hospital in DC. I should hear from them by the first of May. We shall see. Kudos to Brian for having the foresight to pick Xavier to go this far. I would not be surprised to see them beat Duke tomorrow. My bracket turned to crap relatively quickly thanks to early exits by two of my final four teams, thanks Providence and Wisconsin! Anywho, I have to open up more books and try to convince myself I'm actually being productive in my studies.

I'm wearing my freshly-purchased urlLink Vernon Wells jersey with the new Jays logo. I know every team has black as a color, but man, it looks really good with the blue and silver logo. It's Saturday and I am happy it's the weekend. I'm still not feeling spectacular, but it's nice out today, so I have to get out and get some air. I'm excited about baseball starting soon and noticed that the most expensive seats to see a Jays game is $54 in Canadian funds. That's pretty damn good I think to sit on the field in a nice stadium. Anyway, while Kevin may be starting a Master's program, I'm putting mine on hiatus. By the way, Kev, best of luck. I just wasn't into the program at all, and I don't see the point in continuing to get into further debt. I may get back to it a few years down the road. Who knows? Well, I'm gonna go check my mail and watch the Mets game before hanging out with Kim.

Long time, no blog (discounting my St. Patty's Day blessing...). Well, I went and did it. I joined an MBA program. Tonite was our orientation and the first official class, Applied Communication in Organizations, starts Tuesday. This is an accelerated program through the University of New Haven. Each class is 3.5 hours long and meets twice a week. Each class lasts for 5 weeks. So, 22 months from now (Feb. 2, 2006) I will graduate (if I make it that far...) with an MBA. They give us mid-July till the beginning of September off at least. Woohoo (sarcastically...)!!! On top of that, I've been house-hunting for the past month and a half; with no luck. Connecticut is too damn expensive for a single income household, i.e. Me. At least the areas within a normal commute to my job are too expensive, unless I want to live in the ghettos of Bridgeport or New Haven. Which I don't. So, I have until the end of April to find something, or I'll just rent for another year. And on top of all of that, I've just been given double the responsibility at work. I was pretty close to capacity before; but now I am just completely overloaded. It's insane. Needless to say, I hate my job even more than before. It's got to get better, doesn't it?!?!? Oh, and they just laid off 92 people today. I feel fairly secure in my position. I think I've made my self valuable enough that they can't fire me... yet... So, I think there is a pool forming for when I am going to have a nervous breakdown... At least the house hunting is only going to last for another month; but if I do find something, then I am going to have to deal with trying to pay for it. And if they MBA gets to be too much, I will just drop out of the accelerated program and go into a regular part time program. Oh well, that's it for me. I'm gonna go back to sucking my thumb while laying in the fetal position in the corner, waiting for the next 22 months to pass...

Hellooooo. I spent last night not going to class. I felt like crap. I don't know if it's a cold or allergies, but I just felt terrible overall. Tired especially. I'm stuffy today and still tired, even though I slept 800 hours. Probably going to class tonite, unless I suddenly feel worse, but hopefully that won't happen. I got a haircut this morning, so the girl who cuts my hair and I took turns sniffling, since she is also sick. I did some work last night for some of my papers that are due at the end of the semester, but my eyelids were too heavy to do much. I did a little more this morning. Don't feel like doing much, though. I'm still feeling very blah. I have further reason to hate Warren Sapp now. I hope the Raiders go 0-16 this year. Oh yeah, the Bengals still don't have a starting cornerback. Hey Garet, how's your cover skills? As for the NCAAs, I'm glad I didn't enter a pool, but I filled out a bracket for shits & giggles. I usually pick a bunch of wacky teams, and Maryland has been a pick for me to go to the finals for like 6 consecutive years. My final four is a joke, but I still have some teams alive...I had GT, Ok State, Maryland, and Xavier(sorry Matt, but I fantasized about Illinois beating Duke in my bracket...it could happen. hahahahahahahahahahaha). Anyway, I still did well considering all the upsets that happened. I actually picked quite a few, but it doesn't matter anyway, since I'm not in a pool. Somehow, the Cuse is still alive, which I didn't think would happen either. In the possible-good news front, my excellent sister in law Rachel is putting in a good word for me as a teacher in Howell. Here's to hoping she's a good persuasionist. There's only so much more I can take of this walgreens nonsense. Hey Rob, we may come up to visit you in Boston for a weekend this summer, so get the pinata and clown ready for a kick-ass party.

Happy St. Patrick's Day to one and all. Here is an old irish blessing for you: When we drink, we get drunk. When we get drunk, we fall asleep. When we fall asleep, we commit no sin. When we commit no sin, we go to heaven. So, let's all get drunk, and go to heaven!

Home again from work due to illness:( So since I am doing nothing of importance, I've decided to take a look at an old blog about new year's resolutions. Let's see how I'm doing shall we? 1. Stay away from red meat... Not doing too badly with this one. I'm actually at the point where eating a burger makes me feel ill. Is this bad? 2. No fried foods.... Doing well with this too, but when I do eat fried foods its usually in that yummy salad at bennigans or fried fish. 3. When I'm mad at someone, I usually take it out on an innocent person... I haven't really gotten too upset with anyone yet, but I'm sure it's bound to happen. 4. Exercise more... Yeah right. There have been talks about running again but the stairmaster thing has yet to happen. 5. No more road rage.... I've calmed down slightly, but there are some really bad drivers out there that require me to curse at them even though they can't hear me. 6. Save more money... I haven't been spending a lot of my money on stupid stuff, but I need new clothes for the summer for both work and casual time. I'm pretty sure my savings will dwindle then. 7. Continue to not eat after 8pm.... This has never really been a problem for me. I think I picked this resolution because I know it's the only one I wouldn't mess up. 8. Stay away from ice cream... Haven't been doing so well with this one. It's always when we go to Friendly's. So I hereby declare I shall not go to Friendly's more than once a month. So I guess I'm not doing so badly. It's just that damn exercise thing. Walking 10 miles around campus with a 50 pound bag has to count as exercise right?

It's Sunday, and as usual, I already don't want Monday to come. This week it's not as bad as usual because I know I don't have school this week. I still have to try to do a lot of homework, however, because I will always be behind once classes resume next week. Too much reading and writing. Anyway, yesterday was fun. Despite Kim still not feeling well, she was a champ, and still had the energy to hang out. We went to Houlihan's in Weehawken, which is right along the piers. It would have been even more beautiful if it wasn't so cold and windy outside. We ate their dirty nachos and had a damn good meal afterwards. We decided to catch a movie at the venerable Allwood theater. It's 6 bucks to get in as opposed to 9 or 10 elsewhere. We decided on Hidalgo because it was playing sooner than the Johnny Depp movie, which I didn't really want to see anyway. So it started at 4:30 and ended just before 7. It was a little long, but enjoyable. It was nice not hearing a movie spattered with "fucks," "shits," and "assholes." I don't think there were any of those;in fact, I think the only word I heard only a few times was "hell." And there wasn't any gratuitous sex or any at all for that matter, which surprisingly was refreshing. It was just a good ol' adventure along the lines of a hero like Indiana Jones, but with not nearly as much action sequences. We went home afterwards to eat our dinner of hot pretzels and watched South Park and Chappelle's Show until Kim had to go home. I got a jury summons the other day. This is gonna be the first time I'll have to go, and I'm not real excited about it. It's April 20th, which is a few days before my bday, and it's on my only day off(Tuesday). I am not a fan of driving into Newark in the first place, so I hope I only have to report one day and get dismissed. If I'm real lucky, I'll get called off the night before. I got summoned while at WP, but I got excused because I was working to pay off my school, and had classes that conflicted. Also, I have to renew my license before the end of April, and there's all this new crap that you need in NJ now. I need a civil birth certificate issued by the state(not the one from the hospital), as well as two other forms of ID and proof of address. And I'll still have to wait in line for 2 hours. I hope these digital licenses are worth it, because no one believes my age, so there's really no way I could fake this ID.

I finally got it... The evil cold that has been going around has finally reached me. Although I told the cold I didn't have time for it in my schedule, that dirty bastard insisted on making me sleepy and stuffy, as well as give me a sore throat. I actually stayed home from work today to rest so my cold wouldn't get any worse and hopefully it helped a little. I slept most of the day which is very shocking. I never sleep, especially when I'm sick. I usually stay up to watch those dirty talk shows I would never otherwise be able to see. But I woke up today at 7, ate breakfast and didn't move from the kitchen table. All I thought was, "ok kim. you should go take a shower and get ready for work. you shall be productive!" I did not listen to myself though. Aroung ten to eight I left a message on my bosses phone telling him I wasn't coming in. I'm sure he was excited to know I wasn't going to be there hounding him every ten minutes for something to do. Anyhoo, I talked to my friend Ryan from Chicago today and we talked food. It started with me saying that I wanted egg drop soup and it continued from there. I had mentioned something about the new Thai restaurant by Bri's house and he said we should go. Thai is one of his favorites so he recommended some dishes to try. Although they sounded yummy, he said thai food was on the spicy side and I'm not too much of a fan of spicy food, but I'll try it. I'm kinda tired of eating at the same places every week (sorry Bennigans!). Spring break is upon all at Montclair State University and of course I'll be working and probably still feeling sick. I'm not really looking forward to it because I'm not going away to a tropical place, but not for nothing I don't really want to go at this time. The prices are really high now because it is spring break time and you won't be able to escape the drunk morons who will probably be in the gutter, face down in their own vomit. Not that I have anything against drinking. I'm against the people who do it all the time and have no clue how to handle themselves. Just say no boys and girls! A girl in one of my classes asked if I was going away for spring break and i said, "no. i dont do body shots." She thought it was hilarious. Going to stop blogging now because I probably don't make any sense. Bye!

Next week is spring break! Woo! Not real sure what that means, but no class at least. I guess it's like a catch-up week for my work, but I just don't want to do it at all...I talked to my friend Evan, who I met while subbing in Livingston, and he just got a job in Newark. His briefcase has his planbook, some worksheets, and a gat. Protect ya neck. No seriously, how he ended up there is a funny story I would have to tell you in person. I'm addicted to Planter's Honey Roasted Peanuts right now. I bought a can from work, and haven't been able to stop eating them all night, except while eating dinner. Looking more and more forward to the warmer weather. We have plans on purchasing bicycles this summer to get around as a backup to resuming our jogging schedule. I can't wait to get back into the air. I need to get my blood pumping and stuff. I also really want to play some ball, but they took away my court in Nutley. I think they're putting up a monument for Martha Stewart in its place. Ba-zing. No, they just tore it up for no reason. Looks like I'll be playing in my crooked-ass yard full of tree roots... NFL free agency is always an adventure. You can't buy a jersey of your favorite player because more than likely, he won't be on the team for more than 3 years. Over the past two seasons, however, I have begun to like it because the Bengals actually have a chance at signing some decent players. This year they brought in 2 new defensive starters, as well as re-signed their awesome kicker and center. They did decide to cut both of their starting cornerbacks from last season without signing a replacement for either yet, although they are supposed to sign either Bobby Taylor or Troy Vincent. While I'm on the subject of sports, I am really glad the Rangers cleaned house and brought in some fresh faces. They got rid of a lot of waste, but still have an abundance of it(Tom Poti, Darius Kasparaitis). They got rid of the only player who represented the team for the past 15 years, which was upsetting, but his play isn't nearly as good as it once was. They'll finally have a chance to give their younger guys(young in terms of Rangers years) more of a chance(LaCouture, Ortmeyer, Purinton, Lundmark). They're not the best, but it's better than watching a bunch of underachieving 40-year-olds skate around aimlessly. Hmm, what else, the NCAAs are around the corner, and my 6 year tradition of picking Maryland won't continue this year. Actually, I think I picked Kansas last year. Luckily I was wrong as usual. I miss the bloggers. Looks like I'll be doing some phone usage to get your asses back up here. There's no humor here without you guys!
