With all this hype about the Mel Gibson film, The Passion of The Christ or something like that, I was thinking that the actor who plays Jesus in the movie can't really get another role. It's like, "Hey man, I just got the part of Stiffler in American Pie 4." "Oh yeah, well I was Jesus ." I mean once you're Jesus, you can't really get a bigger role, so I guess his acting days are over. Anyway, did anyone actually see the movie? I'm curious about it, but am afraid I may not get the full effect of it since I'm not really religious... Today's my brother's birthday. Happy birthday, even though I don't think you read this. I got my first paper back from my theories class. He gave me an A and wrote many compliments on it. I was happy because I don't think I did A work, and even if I did, it was largely due to the fact that everyone shared their ideas with the class and was given feedback before we worked on the paper alone. So I handed in my second paper today, and am glad I have that A, because this will surely even out the grade to a solid B. I honestly had no idea what I was talking about, but only time will tell what el profesor feels. I'm relieved that school is over for the week, unfortunately, I have to be at work at 8 tomorrow. Zoinks! I'm contemplating my future at grad school because I feel like I'm struggling with the material, and feel as if I'm not really ready to commit myself to it at this time. I'm hoping things get a bit easier as I get further into different classes, but right now I'm completely overwhelmed and pressed because whether I go back or not, I don't want to do poorly. As for Kim's previous post, I think it would be nice to spend a week at my brother's house alone. We care for their fish and maintain their pool, etc, but we get to lounge around, stay away from work, hit the beach, hit the pool, and possibly have a get-together (hint). Nothing outrageous, but a little fun nonetheless. So I look forward to that, and the possibility of finding a teaching job. Yes, I'm gonna try again after taking a reprieve, since I need a real job first, and then I can always go back to grad school. It should be another interesting few months ahead.

So Wow.. It's been about a month since my last blog and with good reason. Nothing exciting is happening. Just school, work, and very little down time. The only day that I do absolutely nothing is... umm... there isn't a day!! I guess I can't say I'm bored right? So although Brian and I have no money to go on vacation, we're probably going down to Brian's brothers house in Point Pleasant for a week while he's in Peru. There are some bonuses: BONUS 1- Rachel's leaving the keys to the convertible. BONUS 2- They have a pool and a decent backyard to chill out in. BONUS 3- I believe they have bikes so we won't have to drive to the beach, which leads to BONUS 3- They're only five minutes away from the beach! I think this would be an awesome vacation. It would be very inexpensive. The only thing we would have to pay for is food. Now we're just waiting to see when Kevin and Rachel book the trip. I believe Rach said late June, early July which is prime beach season. I'm excited but I dont wanna get too excited if something doesn't work out. NOT A BONUS: We're still in New Jersey. So that's about the most exciting thing that has happened in a month for me. On the other hand, I have been getting nothing but A's in all my classes and I'm sure you're all so very proud... hehe. Hope everyone is doing well!

Belated Birthday wishes to Brian. In scary and disturbing news, I am done with classes and just have to present my case report to the faculty on Tuesday, with graduation to follow next Sunday. The job hunt has been going pretty well. I've been looking to head back to the DC area and have been offered one job so far, with one phone interview later today and a four interview in three day sprint coming up in mid-May. Tough decisions, but the good kind of tough decisions, as opposed to not having any job at all. This weekend (and all of next week most likely) will be a horrible sloppy mess, so Sparta, if you're interested in seeing some drunk PT students, give me a call. As a bonus we'll probably end up at Player's (also known as the worst possible club ever). In continuing with the anti-Eli sentiment, I agree that he is a punk-ass. I hope Phillip Rivers becomes Drew Bledsoe to Eli's Ryan Leaf. One can only dream. Good luck to all in their finals weeks of classes, projects, and all that.

Yeah, so I'm blogging again. First I just want to say I'm sorry to anyone who has been getting email from freeflixtix.com . For some reason, I thought it would be beneficial to sign up and get movie tickets. I didn't realize they would bombard my friends with emails pestering them to sign up. So I cancelled my account today when I finally found out what the actual website was, and anyone who didn't sign up and was getting emails should stop receiving them. urlLink Let me know if you get any more... I got to work at 5:30 this morning to unload our shipment, and just happened to look at the schedule for today and found that I was mysteriously scheduled to stay an hour later than normal. Good thing I looked. So I stayed until 2:30, came home, washed my car and cleaned the interior. I took a shower and now I'm doing this. I'm tired as hell, and may be falling asleep around 8 or so tonite. I listened to the Guns N Roses Greatest Hits CD yesterday, and that was fun. I got it for $9.99 at Best Buy on Sunday. Good deal...You know I never thought I'd hear myself say this, but I wish the Jays had Billy Koch as their closer still. Their bullpen has been bizarre to say the least the past 2 years. I found out the 311 tix are gonna be $32.50 each. That's a pretty tough pill to swallow, because "convenience" charges and taxes and such will probably bring them to $40 each. That's an awful lot for a show, but they do put on a good show. The Roots open, so that should be interesting. Do I go or pass? Too tired to do any homework tonite, but have this urge to play basketball strangely enough, even though I can barely keep my eyes open. Suffice it to say I will not be basketball jones tonite, rather, I'll be lazy jones. That's all for now. Peace out.

Holy crap I'm old! Thanks for the wishes kids. gracias. I had my Tuesday class from 4-5:30 tonite. He had some banquet to attend tonite, so we got to leave early, and the classtime was cut in half to boot! Unfortunately I have to wake up at 4 to work tomorrow. Ugh. 2 more weeks of school, and 2 more weeks to finish up my 3 papers. Can't wait. I cut my lip today, I guess while shaving, and it didn't stop bleeding until about 3:50, when I was walking to class...Yes, Eli Manning will get his ass kicked every game next year because the Giants have no line. Rock! My birthday details...hmmm. Dinner was good I guess-Ribeye with sweet potato was tasty. I got some nice gifts-2 shirts, a new basketball, MLB 2005 for PS2, Trivial Pursuit Pop Culture game with dvd, some money. All stuff I needed or will definitely use. We're going to see Braid on June 7th, and 311 tix go on sale Saturday for a show July 24 at the PNC center. Nice!

Happy B-day Brian!! I'm finally done with classes as of today!! Only 2 more classes to take for the rest of my life next semester and I'm finally free. This semester has benn totally hellish in terms of classes and work, so I'm so happy it is finally over. In June, I get my master's degree, which signifies the halfway point of graduate school. This past week was pretty enjoyable, I saw Death Cab for Cutie and Stereolab at The Cat's Cradle in Carrboro. Both were pretty good shows. Next month, I get to go to Vancouver for a conference. hopefully Todd Bertuzzi won't be there to beat me up. Anyway, the blogs should be more frequent now that I have some spare time. Hope everyone is doing well. Talk to you later! BTW, Eli Manning is punk and I hope he gets his ass kicked every game next year.

HAPPY BIRTHDAY BRIAN!!!! That's right everyone, today is Bri's 25th and last nite we went out to celebrate this joyous event by going out to eat with his parents, Nana, Kevin and Rachel to the Outback. I'll let Bri give the details.. not like there a lot to tell. Sorry for the short blog but I must do some homework :( Later!

Nilidigiphaguf Day goes back to a country in Africa once known as Botswanaland, but has since been renamed Mozambique. On April 13 it was said that the indigenous people of the country set fire to their weapons in hopes of releasing the evil blood that may be left on them [the wooden handles are turned to ashes, which are then sprinkled on the first born child to protect him/her from evil spirits. The metal is melted down and reformed into statues of their "good" gods. So that's the tale of Nilidigiphaguf Day. Hey Rob, I just read that the Pats acquired Corey Dillon for a second rounder. I'm happy for you, but scared at the same time, because as much as I hate the guy, he's a damn good runner. Pats repeat!? I am glad Kim got the classes she wanted because I feel awful about something that happened in her current music class. We were supposed to attend a classical concert on Saturday[long story] but ended up not attending for various reasons when we arrived. She was obviously upset because the show was in Rahway, and she drove all the way down there and couldn't go. Anyway, since I'm such an honest person, I tell her to email her professor and tell him exactly what happened and that you made the effort to go, but circumstances prevented you from going. Anyway, he emailed her back and told her she has to attend another concert instead and report on it. If she hadn't emailed her professor, she probably could have copied someone's program and b.s'd the report. Sorry. Oh, that Nilidigiphaguf story was made up. Rob made up the word when we were playing Scrabble a long time ago on April 13th.

Just finished registering for the summer and fall at MSU. I'm pretty happy about my fall schedule even though some of the classes are crappy. The summer is a different story. I'll be taking 2 classes (yuck!) but I'll be finished with both by July 8. So if anyone cares here are my classes: Summer Classes: - Intro to Jazz.. the Intro to Music class I'm taking now does not satisfy the fine and performing arts class for me. I sure am glad someone told me this before the deadline to withdraw expired. - Earth & the Environment... Isn't it exciting that I get to look at rocks 4 days a week for 4 weeks at 4 hours at a time.. lots of 4's there. Fall Schedule: - Intro to Chinese Civilization.. ok, so it may not be interesting but maybe the professor will bring in some good food for us. - Contemporary Issues: National Issues... stupid requirement. just in time for elections - Intro to Marketing.. Probably not that interesting but I heard the professor is easy though. - Statistics for Business.. Whenever I can take a math class, I'm happy. Plus, I heard this professor is easy too. - Intro to International Business.. Another requirement but this time it's a general requirement for business majors. I don't particularly care for this topic but I gotta take it. So that's that. I actually got my classes at the time I wanted so that was a plus. I guess it pays to be an upperclassman. WooHoo! Finally a junior! That means only 2 years to go.. It seems so close yet so far. Am I the only one who has no clue what Nilidigiphaguf Day is?

The NFL schedules came out the other day, and I'm going to list the urlLink Bengals schedule, not because anyone wants to see it, but more for my own reference so I can look back and see who they play... 09.12 @ Jets 09.19 MIAMI [Sunday nite-ESPN] 09.26 BALT 10.03 @ Pitt 10.10 BYE WEEK 10.17 @ Cle 10.25 DENVER [Monday nite!-ABC] 10.31 @ Tenn 11.07 DALL 11.14 @ Wash 11.21 PITT 11.28 CLE 12.05 @ Bal 12.12 @ New Eng 12.19 BUFF 12.26 GIANTS 01.02 @ Phi First of all, holy crap, they're on national tv 2 times, and they haven't been on Monday nite in like 15 years. Secondly, holy crap, that schedule is no fun. They play the Jets and Giants, so I get to see them 2 more times, and they end against the Eagles-brotherly rivalry. Anyway, I was excited to see Monday nite, but wish it was a game they could win.

Tax Day for about another hour. Hope all you procrastinators got that shizzy out in time...I got home from work tonight and saw a duck in my neighbor's driveway. Normally I would say "Hey duck" and continue walking to my door, but something didn't seem right. He was wobbling quite a bit and when I stopped walking to watch him, I noticed he was trying to quack but no sound was coming out. I felt so bad, so I went inside and told my dad and mom. They came out to have a looksy and said to try and call the animal shelter. No one answered but a robot voice. So I called the police non-emergency line and the guy said that animal control isn't there after 5(it was 7:30 or so), but he said he'd try to call some wildlife guy. A few minutes pass and the animal control officer called me. He asked me some questions and told me to see if the duck moved when I chased him. He moved...from my neigbor's driveway to my front lawn. If you don't know my front lawn, then I'll tell you it's all on a hill. The duck struggled to get up the hill on a gimpy leg, but somehow did it. He nested there for a while, and then suddenly fell down the hill and onto his back. He took a while to turn right side up, but finally did, and chilled on my sidewalk. I felt bad for him. Finally the animal control officer called me back and asked me some more questions before I said to come get him because he was obviously injured and would have been eaten by a cat or something if left alone. The guy was there in about 10 minutes and took the duck with him. I don't know the duck's fate, but at least I felt good getting him some help to maybe fix his injured leg. I worked at 5:30 yesterday morning, and it was frankly a little creepy driving to work at that time. No one was on the road really and it was dark, yet someone still managed to almost hit me in Wallington-the town with the worst drivers in America-on my way to work. It went pretty quickly as I left at 1:30. I couldn't really sleep when I got home, so I ate lunch and showered. I fell asleep for about an hour before dinner, and went to bed after watching another pretty funny South Park . Today I went in at 10, and my mind was all flustered. I felt like I should have been going home at like 4, even though I had to stay until 7. Anyway, back to normal 8-5 tomorrow before the weekend starts. Warmer weather in the outlook before jury duty on Tuesday. I got some good directions and advice, so hopefully my nervousness won't be at its height on Tuesday morning. Gotta go to bed soon. Enjoy the weekend!
A very happy, though slightly belated, Happy Nilidigiphaguf Day to you all indeed.
Happy Nilidigiphaguf Day! I just found out I have to be at work for 5:30 am tomorrow. I think I'll be going to sleep as soon as I get home from class...

I'm going to sound mushy for the first part of this blog, so don't read it if you don't want to...I felt extremely lucky today. After all the times that I complain on this blog about how much shit luck I have and how much I hate my job and school, and how broke I am, I was thinking how lucky I am to have such a tremendous girlfriend. I guess maybe I'm getting over the fact that lots of people have things much worse than I do, but I believe it's just another sign of reasons why I want to spend my life with her. When muddling thru a crappy Monday at only 10:30 in the morning on a day that consists of working to 3, going directly to the doctor, home to change and up to class, I found myself smiling after thinking about her. And the sign of how true that one moment was this morning, she ended up calling me at work no less than an hour after that smile came across my face. I'm lucky to have such a wonderful partner. I hope me saying this doesn't come off as bragging or I hope it doesn't make anyone feel bad, but it's actually just me hoping that my awesome friends have found or will find someone that will make them feel as lucky as I do. If you are still reading, I'll breakdown my weekend. Friday I worked, went to the doctor, and went to China Garden for dinner with Kim. Good food and ate some good pistachio ice cream for dessert. Saturday we grabbed lunch, bought some cds and the Weezer dvd, and dyed some eggs for Easter. As Kim mentioned, we made an appearance at our friend Brandon's house, where we also chatted with John and Kate. It was nice to see old friends doing well. On Sunday, I ate Easter dinner with my family and picked up Kim afterwards to come back to my grandmother's house where we watched the Mets game and Arena football. Watched Alias at night and did my homework after. Thus ended the weekend. Did anyone see South Park last week? I missed it, but heard it was humorous. So, I heard you got served. Looking forward to seeing where the Sixers trade Iverson. Actually, as much as I'm sure most people hate him, I still like him. They've got some good players on the team, but they just need a few more pieces. Willie Green, Korver, and Salmons are solid to decent fill-ins, with Green having talent to be a starter. Dalembert is a monster in the making, and Kenny Thomas and Snow are still real good players. Big Dog was a big waste, and DC's career is over, but if Marc Jackson recovers from his injury for next year, he will play as well as he did before the injury. Anyone got Atari? I've got an itch to play some Dig Dug.

Today is Easter and I've noticed it is probably the worse holiday of the year. No one even knows what we're celebrating, including me. The upside is eating good food and the downside is sitting around the house with relatives you really don't want to see for the most part. I've also noticed the next big holiday is Thanksgiving. Now you might be saying, "But Kim, what about Memorial Day and Labor Day?" Those holidays are kinda cool because it's all about bbq-ing and warm weather, but these typically aren't family holidays, which I think are desperately needed by those like me who despise sitting with relatives talking about the same stuff you talked about the last time you saw each other... I guess you can say I'm not a big family get-together person. I don't think I'll mind it as much once I get my own place and start my own holiday traditions. Anyhoo, I would talk about how interesting my life is but it really isn't. Just work and school. Nothing new. Oh, but there was some fun last nite. Me and Brian went by Brandon's house. It was a spur of the moment thing and I was glad I went. It was nice to see Brandon as well as Katie and John. Itwas also cool to meet some new people. I think there were about 10 people there at one time and 5 of us are/were Sam Goody employees. Crazy. We talked about all the silly stuff we did. Good time had by all. Hope to see them all again soon. Time to eat the traditonal ham and kielbasa. Later.

Hello blog. I will apologize for being out of contact once again for a while. I've been fairly busy with random things, but that is no excuse damnit! Anyhow. I've been working at the theater a decent amount still. A couple weekends ago, I went to Atlantic City for a bachelor party of my college roommate. That town is rotting, but there are casinos. Anyway, his wedding is April 17th, so I'm going to that event as well. I think he's getting married in Florham Park. My mother is convinced it is in a castle for some reason. I think not. I've been spending most of my free time hanging around with a variety of people with whom I work. I've been doing this for a long time, but it seems this past week has been especially so. Some people major in all sorts of things, like dancing and choreography, for example. Other choices include radio broadcasting, saxophone, marine biology, french literature, but mostly psychology and creative writing. I don't really understand some of them, but it seems nobody understands what I studied. Anyhow, I feel pretty confident in figuring out whatever I need to, whereas I think none will ever figure out physics. Speaking of physics, I'm really horrible at pool. I have always been so, but I guess I forgot. Also speaking of physics, I went to a foot doctor and got orthotics since he told me my 'bio-mechanics' of walking were harmful. Anyhow, I've had these things 2 days and today when I woke up my big toe on my left foot is in excrutiating pain, which is odd since my feet felt fine when I was actually wearing the orthotics. I think they shall be adjusted. I think I don't have any more 'speaking of physics's'. I hope everything is well with all of you. I will post again soon. -R

The fun at my uncle's house this past Sunday was beyond words, but I cannot post pictures on this site, so you cannot see what a shit time I had. Needless to say, I'm just as excited about the most boring holiday coming up this Sunday. I finished my homework for tonite's class and I'm waiting for Kim to get home from seeing her advisor before we grab a bite and head back up to school. The game last night was pretty ugly, and it only finished as close as it did because UConn slowed down their pace and lost their momentum for the last 10 minutes of game time. The final four games made up for the lackluster final anyhow. Good start for the Jays, but I can't say I wasn't expecting the opening day loss. They didn't start well last season either, and Halladay started 0-5 or something. Besides, everyone kept saying how Halladay is dominant when facing Detroit. Jinx. Also, Lawrence Rocca, baseball columnist for the Star Ledger picked Toronto to win the World Series. I can't say I wasn't slightly excited by this, but is he serious. Their GM doesn't even think they'll be in the playoffs until next season. I'm going to renew my license this Thursday, so we'll see what all the fuss is about for these new digital licenses. I'm gonna go twiddle my thumbs now.

As Brian said, this weekend was great but today just sucks. It's raining right now and I'm stuck home writing a paper for my Intro to Jazz class. I should have done it a few days ago but who does what they should? The paper will give me something to do besides sit here and play free cell or lemonade game urlLink . Maybe after the paper, I'll read a book or something else nerdy.

Hope everyone had an enjoyable weekend. Unfortunately, it's gloomy today. I had a pretty nice weekend up until today, when I have to work 3-11. Saturday, Kim & I went to urlLink my brother & sister-in-law's house down the shore. We helped them finish putting rocks down in their yard and then had a big bbq to reward ourselves. Had a burger, 2 dogs, beans, corn, fritos with hummus, tostitos, pickles, tomato & fresh mozzarella, malibu & pineapple juice, fruit salad, some cake, and I think that's it. Pretty good variety of foods. We watched some Chappelle's Show and then Dane Cook 's comedy special before turning in for the night. Woke up Sunday with a very tight back and quite tired. Rachel made us all some good waffles with some fruit salad and sausage for breakfast. We then helped to clean off their pool cover and put up a gazebo in their yard. Their yard looks amazing with the rocks and the pool opened. There's still a lot of room to play with a tiki bar or urlLink wiffle ball field. After showering, my bro & I played a good game of wiffle ball homerun derby for old time's sake. He won in 10 innings 6-5. Obviously we felt the rust since we hadn't played in some time, plus our swings hurt our backs more than the shoveling from Saturday. When we returned to the house, we were hungry, and decided to get lunch from a friendly place known as urlLink Surf Taco . Mmm, that was good, but left us all feeling like blimps. So we went to sit our lazy asses in the sun by the pool for a bit and just talked and listened to some tunes. After a game of HORSE with my brother, we got some ice cream and felt fat again. We proceeded to chill and then it suddenly became cold and cloudy. We stayed out for a bit, but started cleaning up and went inside. We watched the dvd Evolution , which I think did poorly in theaters, but was supposed to do well. Anyway, we all enjoyed it, and I thought it was better than the first two times I saw it. After dinner, we ate some dirty shrimp and waited for our filet minons to grill. Good dinner. After cleaning up, Kim & I had to drive home. Overall, a relaxing weekend with lots of good food. The ride home was somewhat crappy due to a huge backup at the Driscoll Bridge (somewhere around exit 129). Mostly before and after that, we were at least driving at a tolerable pace. Now it's time to mope until 2:30 when I leave for work. Can't wait until our week in July. Oh crap, it's not even June yet.

Jogging was fun today. It's been a while. It felt good, but at the same time, my legs burned. Also, at the end, my stomach decided to convulse and finally digest my food from yesterday, causing me some discomfort(i.e. a stomach ache). I'll probably be really tired at work, especially since I have to be there until 11. Yikes! The jazz place was pretty cool. It was something different that's for sure. I definitely would have enjoyed it more if I had not had to wake up at 4:30 in the morning for work. I don't know what I'm going to do today before work. I'll probably clean my room or something. I'd clean my car, but it looks like rain again. I'm sure I'll end up blogging again later.

Last nite Brian and I went to urlLink Trumpets in Montclair. I had to go see a live jazz performance for my jazz class and instead of going to a smokey nite club in NYC (which I would like to do someday) we went there and it was a cool experience. There were only 10 people in the place: 2 performers, 4 employees, and 4 peeps in the audience. The 2 guys were really good. The bass player was extremely good and totally into it. I was shocked to hear Bri say that he would go back to Trumpets. I know I would. The only down side was the high prices for food and drink. Last nite left me with $3 in my wallet. Oh well... Me and Brian are running together tomorrow morning for old time's sake. Hopefully, I won't pass out after the first block. Continuing with the exercise theme, I am planning on joining a gym soon. I don't necessarily need to lose weight but if I happen to shed some pounds I wouldn't complain. My main goal is to tone up a bit. Hopefully my laziness will not prevent me from reaching my goal. Time to iron clothes for tomorrow.. Later.

It was warehouse day at work, which meant getting up at 4:30. The day began on a great note, because at 6 am, a new assistant manager was scheduled(started last week), and me & one of the other assistants were working on unloading the truck and wondered where the other guy was. So the one assistant paged the office to ask where he was. About 5 minutes later, the new assistant comes thru the back door with this attitude about how he didn't like the way the other assistant paged him. The quarrel turned to much louder voices and some other non-relevant personal info was thrown into the assistant's face. The new guy had no right to do this because it's personal business, and he's new, so he doesn't know crap about anyone yet. Anyway, the argument died when the assistant apologized(which he shouldn't have) and said he's sorry the new guy took it the wrong way. About 10 minutes later the new guy starts again by saying how he interpreted the page. I just said it's too early in the morning for this nonsense. After the truck was unloaded, the two assistants talked in the office and settled the matter I guess, but throughout the rest of the day, I could still tell the new guy had a chip on his shoulder. Unbelievable. I wish people would act their age sometimes. Memorial Day weekend is coming up, and I for one am going to Wildwood with Klein to drink skunky Molson Ice and smoke weed with a girl who's allergic to smoke. (This is a reference that only Dennis would understand, sorry!) Seriously, I think we're heading to my brother's on Saturday to help him finish laying out rocks in his yard and opening his pool. We'll stay over and go in the pool Sunday, unless the predictions are right, and it's only 70. Gotta work on Monday, though, but not sure what time yet. Anybody doing anything special?

I knew the Blue Jays were on ESPN's daygame again today, and since I'd be getting home around 3, I figured I'd be able to catch a bit of the end of the game. When I left work, at about 2:40, I turned on the sports scoreboard on the radio, and it was the 7th inning, and the Jays had just taken a 5-2 lead. I got home about 20 minutes later, and the score on the tv screen reads 6-5 Twins, and then I hear something about grand slam and Matt LeCroy. I come to find out that Terry Adams, who blew the game last Weds for the birds gave up a grand slam in the top of the 9th inning, and the Jays were then trailing 6-5. Needless to say, they didn't come back and win in the bottom of the 9th. Again I witness(sort of) the bullpen collapse. I found out my grades last night and did ok. I got a B and an A- It's funny because I thought my grades would be switched, or at least thought I would have done worse in the other class, but I'll take it, especially since I'm probably not going back anytime soon. I'm really tired, so I'm gonna go lie down.

I'm supposed to be at work in about 45 minutes, yet I really don't feel like moving. I'm not even ready yet, either. It's gloomy out, so I guess I'm just in one of those moods where I don't feel like doing a damn thing. Well, I guess I shall be getting ready now. Time for work routine: drive the same way to work, park in the same choice of 3 spots, get my water and walk to the door. Walk in and say hi to the cashier, although I can give a rat's ass how her weekend was, walk to photo and say hi to the photo guy. Punch in the combo to the back area. Glance at the time clock. Notice I'm early as usual. Stare aimlessly at the 2-year-old notices on the bulletin board, and wait until 3 minutes before my shift begins to punch in. As I walk out the door, the manager will call my name, even though he knows I was out there for 10 minutes already and could have talked to me then instead of waiting until my right leg is on the sales floor. Asshole. Let the day begin...

I enjoyed this weekend a lot. I spent most of the time with Kim , and relaxed as well. Today, we had to bring her brother to his home in Sparta, no not that Sparta. We ended up staying there for a while chatting and then we ended up getting free burgers and snacks for dinner which was a bonus. Nice house, nice day, free grub! Upon our arrival home, I was able to use Kim's laptop to burn a mix cd for my car. I tried going with a summery/upbeat mix. Most of the stuff is pretty uninteresting to most folks, but here's how my setlist goes: 01. Feeling This: Blink 182 02. Into the Darkness: No Motiv 03. Sunny Side of the Street: Face to Face 04. Amber: 311 05. Guerilla Radio: Rage Against The Machine 06. It's Been A Blast: Hey Mercedes 07. Cool For One Night: Hot Rod Circuit 08. Blue Groove: Kid With Man Head 09. Does That Make Sense?: The Jealous Sound 10. You've Got So Far To Go: Alkaline Trio 11. A Praise Chorus: Jimmy Eat World 12. Fat Lip: Sum 41 13. Photograph: Weezer 14. Big Brat: Phantom Planet 15. Warning: Incubus 16. Sell My Old Clothes, I'm Off To Heaven: Saves The Day 17. Blue Sky: Dynamite Hack 18. Who's Gonna Save Us?: The Living End 19. J.A.R.: Green Day 20. The Page: Appleseed Cast 21. PS We'll Call You When We Get There: The Juliana Theory 22. Break It Off: Koufax 23. I'm home and not tired enough to go to bed or in the mood to play MLB 2005 or watch a dvd, so I'm blogging again. It was good, but I couldn't eat anymore. It consisted of garden greens, grilled chicken, tortilla strips, cherry tomatoes, shredded jack cheese, toasted pecans, and ranch dressing. Unfortunately, I wouldn't be able to salvage it after having it wrapped up since we were going out. Tomorrow I may wash my car, bowflex, and make a mix cd with the help of Kim's laptop. Time for my crest whitestrips.

I have a few things to look forward to this summer, now that school is over. Besides our "vacation" to my brother's house, I have the honor of attending the Face To Face farewell concert in Irving Plaza. It's Sunday, August 22nd, and I am psyched because I never got the chance to see them live, and was really bummed when they called it quits last year, but they're getting together to do a final run. Should be sweet. Don't know who they're playing with, but I don't care. After getting home from work today, I watched the Blue Jays game on ESPN...unfortunately. They were down 1-0 in the 3rd when I got home, and proceeded to tie the game and take the lead 2-1 in the 5th I think. The Royals tied it at 2, but the Jays took the lead back in the 7th. Kerry Ligtenberg came in for the 8th and left with 2 outs and runners on the corners. Terry Adams, their supposed closer of the moment, came in to get the 3rd out in the 8th. The Jays couldn't do anything in the 8th as Delgado struck out with bases loaded, and then faltered in the 9th again. Adams came back in to close out the game, but didn't have good control. He fell behind 3-1 to Desi Relaford, who's batting .210 this year, and then surrendered a single to him. Aaron Guiel grounded to first, and Relaford moved to 2nd. Angel Berroa grounded to second and Relaford moved to 3rd with 2 outs. Adams then walked Beltran to put runners on the corners and Mike Sweeney lined a ball past Eric Hinske to score both runs and win the game. I watched the game for 3 hours and they lost like that! It sucked. The game must have been 4 hours long because first pitch was 2 pm. Anyway, I was pissed and threw my name tag from work across the room, but soon got over it since I had a feeling Adams didn't have closer stuff...
